name: Panic disorder
Symptoms: Palpitations, Sweating, Trembling, Shortness of breath, Fear of losing control, Dizziness
General Description: A type of anxiety disorder characterized by sudden and repeated episodes of intense fear or discomfort, often accompanied by physical symptoms such as heart palpitations, sweating, or dizziness.
Treatment: Cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT). Medications such as SSRIs or benzodiazepines. Relaxation techniques and lifestyle modifications.

name: Vocal cord polyp
Symptoms: Hoarseness, Vocal Changes, Vocal Fatigue
General Description: Noncancerous growths on the vocal cords caused by vocal strain, irritation, or prolonged use of the voice. They can lead to hoarseness or changes in voice quality.
Treatment: Voice therapy to reduce strain. Surgical removal for severe cases.

name: Turner syndrome
Symptoms: Short stature, Gonadal dysgenesis, Webbed neck, Lymphedema
General Description: A chromosomal disorder in females causing short stature, infertility, and developmental abnormalities.
Treatment: Growth hormone therapy to improve height. Estrogen replacement therapy to initiate puberty. Monitoring and treating associated medical conditions.

name: Cryptorchidism
Symptoms: Absence or undescended testicle(s), empty scrotum, smaller or underdeveloped testicle(s), inguinal hernia, abnormal positioning of the testicle(s) (higher in the groin area)
General Description: A condition in which one or both testicles fail to descend into the scrotum.
Treatment: Orchiopexy surgery to correct the condition. Hormonal therapy may be used in specific cases.

name: Ethylene glycol poisoning-1
Symptoms: Nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, General malaise, weakness, Increased thirst, frequent urination
General Description: Toxicity caused by ingesting antifreeze, leading to symptoms like nausea, vomiting, and kidney failure.
Treatment: Administration of fomepizole or ethanol as antidotes. Supportive care and hemodialysis for severe cases.

name: Ethylene glycol poisoning-2
Symptoms: Metabolic acidosis, apid breathing, rapid heart rate, confusion, headache, dizziness, seizures
General Description: A presentation of antifreeze poisoning with central nervous system depression and acidosis.
Treatment: Administration of fomepizole or ethanol as antidotes. Supportive care and hemodialysis.

name: Ethylene glycol poisoning-3
Symptoms: Decreased urine output, swelling in the legs and ankles, and signs of fluid overload, Severe kidney damage
General Description: Delayed effects of antifreeze poisoning, including kidney failure.
Treatment: Administration of fomepizole or ethanol as antidotes. Hemodialysis and supportive care.

name: Atrophic vaginitis
Symptoms: Vaginal dryness, Vaginal burning, frequent urination, urinary tract infections, Painful intercourse
General Description: Thinning and inflammation of vaginal walls due to low estrogen levels.
Treatment: Topical estrogen therapy. Use of moisturizers and lubricants.

name: Fracture
Symptoms: Pain, Swelling, Bruising, Deformity, Difficulty moving, Loss of function
General Description: A break in the continuity of a bone caused by trauma or other factors.
Treatment: Immobilization with casts or splints. Surgical intervention if needed. Physical therapy for recovery.

name: Cellulitis
Symptoms: Redness, Pain, tenderness, Swelling, Skin changes, Lymph node enlargement
General Description: A bacterial skin infection characterized by redness, swelling, and warmth, often caused by Streptococcus or Staphylococcus bacteria
Treatment: Antibiotics such as cephalexin or clindamycin. Elevation of the affected area to reduce swelling. Pain management with over-the-counter medications.

name: Eye alignment disorder
Symptoms: Double vision, Eye fatigue, Poor depth perception, Head tilting
General Description: A condition where the eyes are not properly aligned, also known as strabismus, which can affect vision and depth perception.
Treatment: Vision therapy exercises. Use of corrective glasses or prisms. Surgical correction in severe cases.

name: Headache after lumbar puncture
Symptoms: throbbing headache
General Description: A common complication of a lumbar puncture caused by leakage of cerebrospinal fluid, leading to low-pressure headaches.
Treatment: Bed rest and hydration. Caffeine intake to alleviate symptoms. Epidural blood patch for persistent headaches.

name: Pyloric stenosis
Symptoms: Persistent hunger, Weight loss, Dehydration, Visible peristalsis, Palpable mass, Fussiness
General Description: A condition in infants where the muscle at the pylorus thickens, obstructing food from entering the small intestine.
Treatment: Surgical intervention called pyloromyotomy. Fluid and electrolyte replacement prior to surgery.

name: Adenoid cystic carcinoma
Symptoms: Lump, swelling, Facial numbness, tingling
General Description: A rare malignant tumor of the salivary glands, characterized by slow growth but high recurrence potential.
Treatment: Surgical resection of the tumor. Radiation therapy to minimize recurrence. Regular follow-ups for monitoring.

name: Pleomorphic adenoma
Symptoms: Painless lump or swelling, Facial changes
General Description: A common benign salivary gland tumor, often occurring in the parotid gland and presenting as a painless mass.
Treatment: Complete surgical excision. Regular monitoring for potential recurrence.

name: Warthin tumor
Symptoms: Painless lump or swelling, Facial changes
General Description: A benign tumor of the salivary gland, typically occurring in the parotid gland and associated with smoking.
Treatment: Surgical removal if symptomatic. Observation in asymptomatic cases.

name: Mucoepidermoid carcinoma
Symptoms: Lump, swelling, Difficulty, pain when swallowing and speaking, Facial weakness, Facial paralysis
General Description: A malignant tumor of the salivary glands with a mixture of mucous and epidermoid cells.
Treatment: Surgical excision with clear margins. Radiation therapy for advanced cases.

name: Acinic cell carcinoma
Symptoms: Lump, swelling, Facial changes
General Description: A slow-growing malignant tumor of the salivary glands that may present as a painless mass.
Treatment: Complete surgical excision. Radiation therapy in cases with incomplete resection or high-grade tumors.

name: Mucocele
Symptoms: Painless fluid-filled swelling in the oral cavity
General Description: A benign lesion caused by mucus accumulation in the salivary glands, often due to trauma or blockage.
Treatment: Surgical removal of the lesion. Avoidance of habits like lip biting to prevent recurrence.

name: Osteochondrosis
Symptoms: Joint pain, stiffness, swelling, reduced range of motion
General Description: A group of disorders affecting bone growth in children, often due to temporary disruption of blood supply.
Treatment: Rest and avoidance of strenuous activities. Physical therapy to restore mobility. Pain management with anti-inflammatory medications.

name: Sialolithiasis
Symptoms: Swelling, pain, tenderness, difficulty eating
General Description: The formation of salivary stones that block the ducts, causing pain and swelling.
Treatment: Hydration and gland massage to expel stones. Sialogogues to stimulate saliva production. Surgical removal for large or persistent stones.

name: Submandibular stones
Symptoms: Swelling, pain, dry mouth, bad taste
General Description: Salivary stones forming in the submandibular gland or its ducts, leading to pain and swelling during meals.
Treatment: Hydration and massage of the gland. Stone removal through sialendoscopy or surgery.

name: Parotid stones
Symptoms: Swelling, pain, dry mouth, bad taste
General Description: Salivary stones forming in the parotid gland or its ducts, often causing intermittent swelling and discomfort.
Treatment: Sialogogues to increase saliva flow. Endoscopic removal of stones. Surgery in refractory cases.

name: Recurrent salivary stones
Symptoms: Frequent episodes of stone formation
General Description: Repeated episodes of salivary stone formation, causing chronic swelling and inflammation of the glands.
Treatment: Hydration and gland massage. Periodic removal of stones. Surgical intervention for recurrent obstructions.

name: Wharton's duct stones
Symptoms: Swelling, pain, dry mouth, bad taste
General Description: alivary stones specifically located in Wharton’s duct, leading to pain and swelling.
Treatment: Hydration and manual manipulation of stones. Endoscopic or surgical removal if necessary.

name: Mumps
Symptoms: Swollen salivary glands (usually parotid), fever, headache, fatigue
General Description: A viral infection affecting the salivary glands, causing swelling, fever, and fatigue.
Treatment: Supportive care with hydration and rest. Pain and fever management with analgesics and antipyretics. Vaccination for prevention.

name: Ludwig's angina
Symptoms: Severe swelling of the floor of the mouth, fever, difficulty swallowing, drooling
General Description: A serious bacterial infection of the floor of the mouth and neck, often resulting from dental infections.
Treatment: Broad-spectrum antibiotics. Airway management if swelling obstructs breathing. Surgical drainage for abscesses.

name: Mucocele
Symptoms: Painless fluid-filled swelling in the oral cavity
General Description: A benign lesion caused by mucus accumulation in the salivary glands, often due to trauma or blockage.
Treatment: Surgical removal of the lesion. Avoidance of habits like lip biting to prevent recurrence.

name: Abscess
Symptoms: Swelling, pain, redness, fever, pus formation
General Description: A localized collection of pus caused by infection, leading to swelling, redness, and pain.
Treatment: Incision and drainage of the abscess. Antibiotic therapy for severe or systemic infections. Pain management with analgesics.

name: Sjögren's syndrome
Symptoms: Dry mouth and eyes, fatigue, joint pain, dry skin
General Description: An autoimmune disorder characterized by dry eyes and mouth due to the immune system attacking moisture-producing glands.
Treatment: Artificial tears for dry eyes. Saliva substitutes or sialogogues for dry mouth. Immunosuppressive therapy for systemic symptoms.

name: Open-Angle Glaucoma
Symptoms: Gradual loss of peripheral vision, tunnel vision
General Description: A common type of glaucoma with gradual loss of peripheral vision due to increased intraocular pressure.
Treatment: Eye drops to reduce intraocular pressure. Laser therapy or surgery to improve fluid drainage.

name: Angle-Closure Glaucoma
Symptoms: Severe eye pain, headache, blurred vision, halos around lights, nausea and vomiting
General Description: A rapid increase in intraocular pressure due to blocked drainage channels, causing pain and vision loss.
Treatment: Immediate medical attention. Medications to lower pressure. Laser or surgical procedures to open drainage pathways.

name: Normal-Tension Glaucoma
Symptoms: Gradual loss of vision, visual field defects
General Description: A form of glaucoma where optic nerve damage occurs despite normal intraocular pressure.
Treatment: Lowering intraocular pressure with eye drops or laser therapy. Regular monitoring of optic nerve health.

name: Congenital Glaucoma
Symptoms: Cloudy or hazy eyes, excessive tearing, sensitivity to light
General Description: A rare condition in infants caused by abnormal development of the eye’s drainage system.
Treatment: Surgery to correct drainage abnormalities. Medications to lower pressure before surgery.

name: Secondary Glaucoma
Symptoms: Varies depending on the underlying cause
General Description: Glaucoma resulting from an underlying condition such as injury, inflammation, or steroid use.
Treatment: Treat the underlying cause. Medications or surgery to control intraocular pressure.

name: Pigmentary Glaucoma
Symptoms: Blurred vision, halos around lights, eye pain
General Description: A type of secondary glaucoma caused by pigment dispersion blocking drainage channels.
Treatment: Eye drops to reduce intraocular pressure. Laser or surgical procedures if needed.

name: Exfoliation Glaucoma
Symptoms: Elevated intraocular pressure, visual field loss
General Description: Glaucoma caused by flaky deposits on the lens and drainage system, obstructing fluid outflow.
Treatment: Medications to lower pressure. Surgery or laser therapy to improve drainage.

name: Ocular Hypertension
Symptoms: Elevated intraocular pressure without optic nerve damage
General Description: Elevated intraocular pressure without signs of optic nerve damage or vision loss.
Treatment: Regular monitoring. Eye drops to lower pressure if necessary.

name: Low-Tension Glaucoma
Symptoms: Gradual loss of vision, visual field defects
General Description: A form of glaucoma where optic nerve damage occurs at relatively low intraocular pressures.
Treatment: Medications to further reduce pressure. Lifestyle changes to improve optic nerve blood flow.

name: Anorexia Nervosa
Symptoms: Extreme weight loss, fear of gaining weight, distorted body image
General Description: An eating disorder characterized by an intense fear of gaining weight and severe restriction of food intake.
Treatment: Nutritional rehabilitation. Cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT). Medical monitoring for complications.

name: Bulimia Nervosa
Symptoms: Recurrent episodes of binge eating followed by purging behaviors
General Description: An eating disorder involving binge eating followed by compensatory behaviors like vomiting or excessive exercise.
Treatment: Psychotherapy such as CBT. Nutritional counseling. Antidepressant medications if needed.

name: Binge Eating Disorder
Symptoms: Recurrent episodes of binge eating without compensatory behaviors
General Description: Recurrent episodes of consuming large amounts of food without compensatory behaviors.
Treatment: CBT to address eating patterns. Nutritional counseling. Medications like lisdexamfetamine for severe cases.

name: Avoidant/Restrictive Food Intake Disorder (ARFID)
Symptoms: Avoidance or restriction of certain foods or entire food groups, significant weight loss or failure to gain weight
General Description: An eating disorder involving avoidance of food due to sensory issues or fear of adverse effects.
Treatment: Nutritional therapy. CBT or other behavioral therapies. Gradual exposure to feared foods.

name: Other Specified Feeding or Eating Disorder (OSFED)
Symptoms: Symptoms that do not meet the full criteria for a specific eating disorder
General Description: Eating disorders that don't meet criteria for specific diagnoses but still cause significant distress.
Treatment: Tailored treatment plan based on symptoms. Psychotherapy. Nutritional counseling.

name: Orthorexia Nervosa
Symptoms: Obsessive focus on "clean" eating, healthy food choices
General Description: An obsession with healthy eating to an extent that it disrupts daily life.
Treatment: Psychotherapy to address obsessive thoughts. Nutritional counseling.

name: Pica
Symptoms: Persistent consumption of non-food substances
General Description: Persistent eating of non-nutritive substances, such as dirt or chalk, often linked to deficiencies or mental health conditions.
Treatment: Behavioral therapy to modify eating habits. Addressing underlying nutrient deficiencies.

name: Rumination Disorder
Symptoms: Repeated regurgitation and re-chewing of food
General Description: A condition where food is regurgitated, re-chewed, and re-swallowed or spit out.
Treatment: Behavioral therapy. Addressing any underlying stress or anxiety.

name: Transient ischemic attack
Symptoms: Sudden onset of neurological symptoms that resolve within 24 hours
General Description: A temporary disruption of blood flow to the brain, often called a “mini-stroke.”
Treatment: Antiplatelet medications like aspirin. Management of risk factors like hypertension and diabetes. Lifestyle changes to prevent recurrence.

name: Pyelonephritis
Symptoms: Fever, chills, back or flank pain, frequent urination
General Description: A bacterial infection of the kidney, often resulting from untreated urinary tract infections.
Treatment: Antibiotics to eliminate infection. Pain relief with analgesics. Hospitalization in severe cases

name: Rotator Cuff Injury
Symptoms: Shoulder pain, weakness or loss of strength, limited range of motion, shoulder stiffness
General Description: Damage or tears to the tendons or muscles of the rotator cuff in the shoulder, often due to overuse or trauma.
Treatment: Rest and physical therapy. Anti-inflammatory medications. Surgery in severe cases.

name: Fibromyalgia
Symptoms: Widespread musculoskeletal pain, fatigue, sleep disturbances
General Description: A chronic condition characterized by widespread pain, fatigue, and tenderness in specific areas of the body.
Treatment: Pain relievers like acetaminophen or antidepressants. Physical therapy. Stress management and regular exercise.

name: Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
Symptoms: Extreme fatigue, cognitive difficulties, unrefreshing sleep
General Description: A long-term condition characterized by extreme fatigue not improved by rest and not explained by an underlying condition.
Treatment: Symptom management with graded exercise therapy. Cognitive behavioral therapy. Medications for pain or sleep issues.

name: Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS)
Symptoms: Severe and persistent pain, changes in skin color or temperature, swelling, stiffness
General Description: A chronic pain condition typically affecting a limb after injury or trauma.
Treatment: Physical therapy to maintain mobility. Medications such as pain relievers or nerve blocks. Psychotherapy for emotional support.

name: Myofascial Pain Syndrome
Symptoms: Localized muscle pain, trigger points
General Description: hronic pain caused by trigger points in muscles or connective tissue.
Treatment: Physical therapy and trigger point injections. Stress reduction techniques. Pain medications as needed.

name: Chronic Migraine
Symptoms: Recurrent, disabling migraines
General Description: Headaches occurring more than 15 days a month, often with severe throbbing pain and other symptoms.
Treatment: Preventive medications like beta-blockers. Acute treatments like triptans. Lifestyle changes and trigger avoidance.

name: Neuropathic Pain
Symptoms: Shooting or burning pain, tingling or numbness
General Description: Pain resulting from damage to nerves, often described as burning, tingling, or shooting pain.
Treatment: Anticonvulsants like gabapentin. Antidepressants like amitriptyline. Topical treatments or nerve blocks.

name: Gestational Diabetes
Symptoms: High blood sugar levels during pregnancy
General Description: High blood sugar levels during pregnancy, affecting the mother and baby’s health.
Treatment: Monitoring blood sugar levels. Dietary adjustments and exercise. Insulin therapy if needed.

name: Pregnancy-Induced Hypertension
Symptoms: High blood pressure during pregnancy
General Description: High blood pressure that develops during pregnancy, typically after 20 weeks.
Treatment: Monitoring blood pressure. Medications to lower blood pressure. Delivery if the condition worsens.

name: Gestational Hypertension
Symptoms: High blood pressure without proteinuria (preeclampsia)
General Description: High blood pressure during pregnancy without protein in the urine or other complications.
Treatment: Blood pressure monitoring. Lifestyle adjustments. Medications for severe cases.

name: Preeclampsia
Symptoms: High blood pressure, proteinuria, swelling, headaches, visual disturbances
General Description: A pregnancy complication characterized by high blood pressure and damage to organs like the liver or kidneys.
Treatment: Monitoring and medications to manage blood pressure. Delivery of the baby if necessary.

name: Hyperemesis Gravidarum
Symptoms: Severe nausea and vomiting during pregnancy
General Description: Severe nausea and vomiting during pregnancy, leading to dehydration and weight loss.
Treatment: Intravenous fluids for rehydration. Anti-nausea medications. Nutritional support if needed.

name: Urinary Tract Infection (UTI)
Symptoms: Painful urination, frequent urination, pelvic pain, cloudy urine
General Description: A bacterial infection in the urinary system, causing pain, frequent urination, and discomfort.
Treatment: Antibiotics to eliminate infection. Increased fluid intake. Pain relievers for discomfort.

name: Anemia
Symptoms: Fatigue, weakness, pale skin, shortness of breath
General Description: A condition where there are not enough healthy red blood cells to carry oxygen, common in pregnancy.
Treatment: Iron and folic acid supplements. Diet rich in iron and vitamin B12.

name: Pregnancy-Related Back Pain
Symptoms: Lower back pain, discomfort in the pelvic area
General Description: Back pain during pregnancy due to hormonal changes, weight gain, and posture changes.
Treatment: Physical therapy and prenatal yoga. Use of supportive devices. Heat or cold therapy.

name: Round Ligament Pain
Symptoms: Sharp or aching pain in the lower abdomen or groin
General Description: Sharp pain or discomfort in the lower abdomen caused by stretching of the round ligament during pregnancy.
Treatment: Rest and changing positions. Gentle stretches or prenatal yoga. Heat therapy for relief.

name: Placenta Previa
Symptoms: Vaginal bleeding, painless bleeding in the third trimester
General Description: A condition where the placenta covers the cervix, potentially causing bleeding during pregnancy.
Treatment: Bed rest and avoiding strenuous activities. Monitoring and potential cesarean delivery.

name: Carpal Tunnel Syndrome
Symptoms: Tingling, numbness, and pain in the hand and fingers
General Description: Compression of the median nerve in the wrist, causing pain, numbness, and tingling.
Treatment: Wrist splints for support. Physical therapy or exercises. Surgery in severe cases.

name: Sciatica
Symptoms: Sharp pain, tingling, or numbness that radiates from the lower back through the hips and down the leg
General Description: Pain radiating along the sciatic nerve, often due to compression or inflammation during pregnancy.
Treatment: Gentle stretches and physical therapy. Heat or cold packs for pain relief. Pain relievers if prescribed.

name: Varicose Veins
Symptoms: Enlarged, swollen veins, often in the legs
General Description: Enlarged, swollen veins that often appear during pregnancy, usually in the legs.
Treatment: Compression stockings. Elevation of legs. Regular movement to improve circulation.

name: Hemorrhoids
Symptoms: Swollen, itchy, or painful veins in the rectal area
General Description: Swollen veins in the rectal area, common during pregnancy due to increased pressure and hormonal changes.
Treatment: Topical creams or suppositories. High-fiber diet and hydration. Sitz baths for comfort.

name: Gestational Cholestasis
Symptoms: Itchy skin, particularly on the hands and feet
General Description: A liver disorder during pregnancy causing itching due to impaired bile flow.
Treatment: Ursodeoxycholic acid to improve bile flow. Close monitoring of mother and baby. Early delivery if necessary.

name: Liver Cancer
Symptoms: Abdominal pain, jaundice (yellowing of the skin and eyes), unexplained weight loss, loss of appetite, fatigue, nausea, vomiting
General Description: A malignant tumor originating in the liver, often linked to hepatitis or cirrhosis.
Treatment: Surgery to remove the tumor. Liver transplantation. Targeted therapy or chemotherapy.

name: Atelectasis
Symptoms: Difficulty breathing, rapid breathing, chest pain
General Description: Partial or complete collapse of the lung, leading to difficulty breathing.
Treatment: Deep breathing exercises. Positive pressure ventilation. Treatment of underlying causes.

name: Ectopic Pregnancy
Symptoms: Vaginal bleeding, abdominal pain or cramping, shoulder pain (if the fallopian tube ruptures)
General Description: A pregnancy where the fertilized egg implants outside the uterus, often in the fallopian tube.
Treatment: Medications like methotrexate to terminate pregnancy. Surgical intervention if necessary.

name: Choledocholithiasis
Symptoms: Abdominal pain (often in the upper right quadrant), jaundice, dark urine, pale stools, nausea, vomiting, endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP) with stone removal, sphincterotomy, Cholecystectomy
General Description: The presence of gallstones in the common bile duct, causing pain and jaundice.
Treatment: Endoscopic removal of stones. Surgery to remove the gallbladder. Antibiotics if infection is present.

name: Cirrhosis
Symptoms: Fatigue, jaundice, abdominal swelling (ascites), easy bruising and bleeding, confusion, loss of appetite, weight loss
General Description: Chronic liver damage leading to scarring and impaired liver function.
Treatment: Avoid alcohol. Manage complications like ascites and encephalopathy. Liver transplant in advanced cases.

name: Thoracic Aortic Aneurysm
Symptoms: Chest or back pain, shortness of breath, hoarseness, difficulty swallowing
General Description: A balloon-like bulge in the thoracic aorta, which can rupture if untreated.
Treatment: Blood pressure control with medications. Surgical repair for large aneurysms.

name: Subdural hemorrhage
Symptoms: Headache, confusion, dizziness, nausea or vomiting, seizures, weakness or numbness
General Description: Bleeding between the dura mater and brain, often caused by trauma.
Treatment: Monitoring for small bleeds. Surgery for larger hematomas. Managing intracranial pressure.

name: Congenital rubella
Symptoms: Developmental delays, intellectual disability, hearing loss, vision problems, heart defects, liver or spleen enlargement, rash at birth
General Description: Birth defects caused by maternal rubella infection during pregnancy.
Treatment: Symptom management and supportive care. Prevention through vaccination.

name: Diabetic retinopathy
Symptoms: Blurred or distorted vision, floaters, impaired color vision, dark or empty areas in the visual field, vision loss
General Description: A diabetes complication causing damage to the retina, potentially leading to blindness.
Treatment: Laser therapy to seal leaking blood vessels. Medications injected into the eye. Tight blood sugar control.

name: Fibromyalgia
Symptoms: Widespread musculoskeletal pain, fatigue, sleep disturbances
General Description: A chronic condition characterized by widespread pain, fatigue, and tenderness in specific areas of the body.
Treatment: Pain relievers like acetaminophen or antidepressants. Physical therapy. Stress management and regular exercise.

name: Ischemia of the Bowel
Symptoms: Severe abdominal pain, bloody stools, diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, fever, rapid heart rate, low blood pressure
General Description: Reduced blood flow to the intestines, leading to tissue damage.
Treatment: Bowel rest and IV fluids. Surgery to remove damaged tissue. Treat underlying vascular conditions.

name: Fetal Alcohol Syndrome
Symptoms: Growth deficiencies, facial abnormalities, developmental delays, intellectual disability
General Description: A condition in babies caused by alcohol consumption during pregnancy, leading to developmental issues.
Treatment: Supportive care and therapies for developmental delays. Behavioral interventions.

name: Peritonitis
Symptoms: Severe abdominal pain, tenderness, bloating, fever, nausea, vomiting, loss of appetite, increased heart rate
General Description: Inflammation of the peritoneum, usually due to infection or perforation in the abdomen.
Treatment: Antibiotics to treat infection. Surgery to address underlying causes. Supportive care with fluids.

name: Abdominal Injury
Symptoms: Abdominal pain, tenderness, bruising, swelling, difficulty breathing, nausea, vomiting, changes in bowel movements, blood in urine or stool
General Description: Trauma to the abdominal region, which can damage internal organs.
Treatment: Stabilization and imaging to assess damage. Surgery for severe injuries. Pain management.

name: Acute Pancreatitis
Symptoms: Severe upper abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, fever, rapid pulse, swollen and tender abdomen, jaundice
General Description: Sudden inflammation of the pancreas, often caused by gallstones or alcohol use.
Treatment: Fasting to rest the pancreas. IV fluids and pain relief. Treat underlying causes.

name: Thrombophlebitis
Symptoms: Redness, warmth, swelling, and tenderness along a vein, pain or discomfort, skin discoloration, visible veins, fever
General Description: Inflammation of a vein due to a blood clot, often in the legs.
Treatment: Compression stockings. Anticoagulant medications. Warm compresses for pain relief.

name: Asthma
Symptoms: Recurrent episodes of wheezing, shortness of breath, chest tightness, coughing, especially at night or in response to triggers such as allergens or exercise
General Description: A chronic condition causing airway inflammation and difficulty breathing.
Treatment: Inhalers for symptom relief and prevention. Avoiding triggers. Long-term control medications.

name: Restless Leg Syndrome
Symptoms: Uncomfortable sensation in the legs, usually in the evening or at night, urge to move legs for relief
General Description: A condition causing an uncontrollable urge to move the legs, often accompanied by discomfort.
Treatment: Lifestyle changes like regular exercise. Iron supplements if deficient. Medications for severe symptoms.

name: Emphysema
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, wheezing, chronic cough, chest tightness, fatigue, weight loss
General Description: A chronic lung condition characterized by damage to air sacs, leading to shortness of breath.
Treatment: Smoking cessation. Inhalers or bronchodilators. Oxygen therapy for advanced cases.

name: Induced Abortion
Symptoms: Vaginal bleeding, cramping, abdominal pain, nausea, fatigue, emotional distress
General Description: A medical procedure to terminate a pregnancy.
Treatment: Medical abortion using medications. Surgical abortion for advanced gestation. Counseling support.

name: Acute Sinusitis
Symptoms: Facial pain or pressure, nasal congestion, thick nasal discharge, post-nasal drip, cough, headache, fatigue, fever (in some cases)
General Description: Inflammation of the sinuses, often due to infection, causing facial pain and congestion.
Treatment: Decongestants and pain relievers. Antibiotics for bacterial infections. Nasal irrigation for symptom relief.

name: Von Hippel-Lindau Disease
Symptoms: Hemangioblastomas (tumors in the brain, spinal cord, or other organs), retinal angiomas (abnormal blood vessel growth in the retina), renal cell carcinomas (kidney tumors), pheochromocytomas (adrenal gland tumors), pancreatic cysts/tumors, other tumors or cysts
General Description: A rare genetic disorder causing tumors and cysts in various parts of the body.
Treatment: Regular monitoring. Surgical removal of tumors. Targeted therapy for specific growths.

name: Alcohol Use Disorder
Symptoms: Cravings for alcohol, inability to control or limit alcohol consumption, withdrawal symptoms (such as tremors, anxiety, sweating) when attempting to stop or reduce alcohol use, continued use despite negative consequences (such as relationship problems, health issues), neglecting responsibilities, tolerance to alcohol
General Description: A chronic condition characterized by an inability to control alcohol consumption despite adverse effects.
Treatment: Behavioral therapies. Medications like naltrexone or acamprosate. Support groups like AA.

name: Opioid Use Disorder
Symptoms: Compulsive use of opioids, strong desire or cravings for opioids, inability to control or reduce opioid use, withdrawal symptoms (such as nausea, muscle aches, anxiety) when attempting to stop or reduce use, tolerance to opioids, continued use despite negative consequences (such as legal issues, health problems)
General Description: Dependence or addiction to opioids, causing significant health and social problems.
Treatment: Medication-assisted therapy with methadone or buprenorphine. Behavioral counseling. Support groups.

name: Stimulant Use Disorder
Symptoms: Increased energy and alertness, euphoria, decreased appetite, increased heart rate and blood pressure, insomnia, restlessness, irritability, paranoia, psychosis (in severe cases)
General Description: Addiction to stimulant drugs like cocaine or amphetamines, leading to physical and psychological harm.
Treatment: Behavioral therapy. Support groups. Medications to manage withdrawal symptoms.

name: Cannabis Use Disorder
Symptoms: Increased appetite, relaxation, altered perception of time, impaired memory and concentration, bloodshot eyes, anxiety or paranoia (in some individuals), withdrawal symptoms (such as irritability, insomnia) when attempting to stop or reduce cannabis use, continued use despite negative consequences (such as relationship problems, job difficulties)
General Description: Excessive use of cannabis leading to dependency and negative effects on daily functioning.
Treatment: Behavioral therapy. Support groups. Lifestyle modifications.

name: Benzodiazepine Use Disorder
Symptoms: Sedation, relaxation, reduced anxiety, drowsiness, poor coordination, memory impairment, withdrawal symptoms (such as rebound anxiety, insomnia, tremors) when attempting to stop or reduce benzodiazepine use, continued use despite negative consequences (such as relationship problems, health risks)
General Description: Dependence on benzodiazepines, often prescribed for anxiety or insomnia.
Treatment: Gradual tapering of dosage. Behavioral therapy. Supportive care for withdrawal.

name: Hallucinogen Use Disorder
Symptoms: Altered perception of reality, visual or auditory hallucinations, changes in sensory experiences, introspective thoughts, feelings of connection or disconnection, anxiety or paranoia (in some individuals), flashbacks (in some individuals)
General Description: Psychological dependence on hallucinogenic drugs like LSD or psilocybin.
Treatment: Behavioral therapies. Support groups. Medical monitoring for complications.

name: Sedative, Hypnotic, or Anxiolytic Use Disorder
Symptoms: Sedation, relaxation, reduced anxiety, drowsiness, poor coordination, memory impairment, withdrawal symptoms (such as rebound anxiety, insomnia, tremors) when attempting to stop or reduce use, continued use despite negative consequences (such as relationship problems, health risks)
General Description: Dependency on sedative medications, often leading to withdrawal symptoms.
Treatment: Gradual tapering of medication. Behavioral therapy. Support groups for recovery.

name: Postpartum Depression
Symptoms: Persistent feelings of sadness, emptiness, or hopelessness, frequent crying, irritability, loss of interest or pleasure in activities, difficulty bonding with the baby, changes in appetite or sleep patterns, overwhelming fatigue, feelings of guilt or worthlessness, trouble concentrating or making decisions, thoughts of self-harm or harming the baby
General Description: Depression occurring after childbirth, marked by sadness, fatigue, and difficulty bonding with the baby.
Treatment: Psychotherapy or counseling. Antidepressant medications. Support from family and friends.

name: Coronary Atherosclerosis
Symptoms: Chest pain or discomfort (angina), shortness of breath, fatigue, irregular heartbeat, dizziness, nausea, sweating, jaw or arm pain (in some cases), heart attack (when a coronary artery becomes completely blocked)
General Description: Hardening and narrowing of coronary arteries due to plaque buildup, leading to reduced blood flow to the heart.
Treatment: Lifestyle changes, including a healthy diet, regular exercise, and smoking cessation. Use medications like statins to lower cholesterol, beta-blockers, or ACE inhibitors. Perform procedures such as angioplasty with stenting or coronary artery bypass surgery for severe cases.

name: Spondylitis
Symptoms: Chronic back pain and stiffness, especially in the morning or after periods of inactivity, limited range of motion in the spine, fatigue, inflammation and pain in other joints (such as hips, shoulders, knees), discomfort or pain in the neck, difficulty maintaining proper posture, tenderness or swelling in affected areas, tingling or numbness in extremities in severe cases
General Description: Inflammation of the vertebrae, often associated with conditions like ankylosing spondylitis.
Treatment: Physical therapy and exercise. Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs). Biologic therapies for severe cases.

name: Pituitary Adenoma
Symptoms: Headaches, vision problems (such as blurred vision or loss of peripheral vision), hormonal imbalances (such as excessive production or deficiency of specific hormones), fatigue, weight gain or loss, menstrual irregularities, infertility, erectile dysfunction, growth abnormalities in children, mood changes, cognitive impairments
General Description: A benign tumor in the pituitary gland, which may affect hormone production.
Treatment: Medications to normalize hormone levels. Surgery for larger tumors. Radiation therapy if necessary.

name: Uterine Fibroids
Symptoms: Heavy or prolonged menstrual periods, pelvic pain or pressure, frequent urination, difficulty emptying the bladder, constipation, backache, leg pain, enlarged abdomen or uterus, infertility or recurrent miscarriages (in some cases)
General Description: Non-cancerous growths in the uterus, which may cause heavy periods, pain, or fertility issues.
Treatment: Medications to regulate hormones. Minimally invasive procedures like uterine artery embolization. Surgical options such as myomectomy or hysterectomy.

name: Idiopathic Nonmenstrual Bleeding
Symptoms: Abnormal vaginal bleeding outside of the menstrual period, unpredictable bleeding episodes, bleeding after sexual intercourse, bleeding after menopause, spotting or light bleeding between periods, prolonged or heavy bleeding
General Description: Unexplained vaginal bleeding unrelated to the menstrual cycle.
Treatment: Hormonal therapy. Diagnostic procedures to identify underlying causes. Surgical intervention if indicated.

name: Chalazion
Symptoms: Painful, red lump or swelling on the eyelid, usually on the upper eyelid, sensitivity to light, blurred vision (if the chalazion affects the line of sight), mild discomfort, tenderness, localized inflammation and swelling
General Description: A small lump in the eyelid caused by a blocked oil gland.
Treatment: Warm compresses to reduce swelling. Surgical drainage if persistent. Antibiotics if infection is present.

name: Ovarian Torsion
Symptoms: Sudden and severe abdominal or pelvic pain on one side, sharp or stabbing pain, nausea, vomiting, fever, rapid heartbeat, abdominal tenderness, bloating, swelling, pain during intercourse, abnormal bleeding or spotting
General Description: Twisting of an ovary, cutting off its blood supply and causing severe abdominal pain.
Treatment: Emergency surgical intervention to untwist the ovary. Oophorectomy if the ovary is nonviable.

name: Vaginal Yeast Infection
Symptoms: Itching and irritation in the vagina and vulva, redness and swelling of the vulva, white, thick, clumpy vaginal discharge (resembling cottage cheese), burning sensation during urination, pain during sexual intercourse, rash or soreness in the affected area
General Description: Overgrowth of yeast in the vagina, causing itching, discharge, and irritation.
Treatment: Antifungal medications, either oral or topical. Maintaining proper hygiene.

name: Mastoiditis
Symptoms: Ear pain (particularly behind the ear), swelling and redness of the ear or the area behind the ear, fever, headache, hearing loss or impaired hearing, drainage of fluid or pus from the ear, earache, irritability (in infants and young children), tenderness or pain when touching the area, mastoid bone protrusion or swelling
General Description: Infection and inflammation of the mastoid bone behind the ear, often following untreated ear infections.
Treatment: Antibiotics to treat infection. Surgery in severe cases to drain the mastoid.

name: Lung Contusion
Symptoms: Chest pain (sharp or dull), difficulty breathing or shortness of breath, rapid or shallow breathing, coughing up blood or pink-tinged sputum, decreased oxygen levels, wheezing, cyanosis (bluish discoloration of the skin), chest wall bruising, rib fractures (associated injuries)
General Description: Bruising of the lung tissue, usually due to trauma, leading to impaired oxygen exchange.
Treatment: Supportive care with oxygen therapy. Pain management. Mechanical ventilation for severe cases.

name: Hypertrophic Obstructive Cardiomyopathy (HOCM)
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, especially during physical activity or exertion, chest pain or discomfort, dizziness or lightheadedness, fainting or near-fainting episodes, heart palpitations (rapid or irregular heartbeat), fatigue, swelling in the ankles, feet, or legs
General Description: A condition where the heart muscle thickens abnormally, obstructing blood flow.
Treatment: Medications like beta-blockers or calcium channel blockers. Surgical options like septal myectomy. Implantable defibrillators in severe cases.

name: Pulmonary Eosinophilia
Symptoms: Cough, shortness of breath, wheezing, chest pain, fever, night sweats, fatigue, weight loss, elevated eosinophil count in the blood or sputum
General Description: Increased eosinophils in the lungs due to allergies, infections, or autoimmune conditions.
Treatment: Treat underlying cause. Corticosteroids to reduce inflammation. Monitoring lung function.

name: Corneal Disorder
Symptoms: Blurred or hazy vision, eye pain or discomfort, redness or irritation of the eye, excessive tearing, sensitivity to light (photophobia), foreign body sensation, dryness or excessive tearing, corneal abrasions or ulcers, distorted or irregular corneal shape, vision loss
General Description: Conditions affecting the cornea, such as infections, dystrophies, or injuries, leading to vision problems.
Treatment: Eye drops or ointments for minor issues. Surgery like corneal transplantation for severe damage.

name: Foreign Body in the Gastrointestinal Tract
Symptoms: Abdominal pain or discomfort, difficulty swallowing, choking or gagging, drooling, nausea or vomiting, loss of appetite, chest pain or pressure, respiratory distress, coughing or wheezing, gastrointestinal bleeding, bowel obstruction, perforation of the digestive tract
General Description: An object accidentally swallowed and lodged in the gastrointestinal system.
Treatment: Endoscopic removal of the object. Surgical intervention if complications occur. Observation if it can pass naturally.

name: Endophthalmitis
Symptoms: Eye pain, redness, swelling, blurred vision, decreased vision, floaters (dark spots or cobwebs in the vision), increased sensitivity to light (photophobia), discharge from the eye, excessive tearing, fever
General Description: Severe inflammation of the eye’s interior, often caused by infection.
Treatment: Intravitreal antibiotics or antifungal agents. Surgical removal of infected tissue. Pain management and supportive care.

name: Achalasia
Symptoms: Difficulty swallowing
General Description: A disorder affecting the esophagus, where muscles fail to relax, making swallowing difficult.
Treatment: Medications like nitrates or calcium channel blockers. Endoscopic balloon dilation. Surgical myotomy.

name: Conductive Hearing Loss
Symptoms: Reduced hearing sensitivity, muffled or blocked sound
General Description: Hearing loss due to problems with sound transmission in the outer or middle ear.
Treatment: Treat underlying causes like earwax or infections. Hearing aids. Surgery in cases of structural damage.

name: Abdominal Hernia
Symptoms: Visible bulge or swelling, discomfort or pain
General Description: A bulge in the abdomen caused by organs pushing through weakened muscle or tissue.
Treatment: Surgical repair to close the hernia. Lifestyle changes to reduce strain.

name: Marijuana Abuse
Symptoms: Impaired memory and cognition, altered judgment, anxiety
General Description: Excessive use of marijuana leading to dependency and negative effects on daily functioning.
Treatment: Behavioral therapy. Support groups. Lifestyle modifications to reduce dependency.

name: Cryptococcosis
Symptoms: Headache, fever, fatigue, cough, meningitis, pneumonia
General Description: A fungal infection caused by Cryptococcus, often affecting the lungs or central nervous system.
Treatment: Antifungal medications like amphotericin B and fluconazole. Supportive care for severe cases.

name: Obesity
Symptoms: Excessive body weight, increased risk of chronic conditions
General Description: A condition characterized by excessive body fat that increases the risk of health problems.
Treatment: Dietary modifications and regular exercise. Behavioral therapy. Medications or bariatric surgery in severe cases.

name: Indigestion
Symptoms: Abdominal pain, bloating, heartburn, nausea, acidic taste
General Description: Discomfort or pain in the upper abdomen due to digestive issues.
Treatment: Antacids or proton pump inhibitors. Dietary adjustments. Avoiding triggers like caffeine and alcohol.

name: Bursitis
Symptoms: Joint pain, swelling, tenderness, limited range of motion
General Description: Inflammation of the bursae, small fluid-filled sacs that cushion joints.
Treatment: Rest and ice application. Anti-inflammatory medications. Aspiration or steroid injections for severe cases.

name: Esophageal Cancer
Symptoms: Difficulty swallowing, unintentional weight loss, chest pain, hoarseness
General Description: Malignant tumor in the esophagus, often associated with smoking or chronic acid reflux.
Treatment: Surgery to remove the tumor. Chemotherapy or radiation therapy. Endoscopic treatments for early-stage cancer.

name: Pulmonary Congestion
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, cough, wheezing, fatigue, chest discomfort or tightness
General Description: Accumulation of fluid in the lungs, often due to heart failure.
Treatment: Diuretics to remove excess fluid. Treating underlying heart conditions. Oxygen therapy if needed.

name: Juvenile Rheumatoid Arthritis
Symptoms: Joint pain, swelling, stiffness, limited range of motion, fever, rash
General Description: A chronic autoimmune condition in children causing joint inflammation and stiffness.
Treatment: NSAIDs or disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs (DMARDs). Physical therapy. Corticosteroids for severe cases.

name: Actinic Keratosis
Symptoms: Rough, scaly patches on the skin, usually in sun-exposed areas
General Description: Precancerous skin lesions caused by prolonged sun exposure.
Treatment: Cryotherapy or laser treatment. Topical medications like 5-fluorouracil. Regular monitoring for changes.

name: Acute Otitis Media
Symptoms: Ear pain, fever, fluid drainage from the ear, hearing loss or muffled hearing in the affected ear
General Description: A middle ear infection causing pain, fever, and hearing difficulty.
Treatment: Pain relievers like acetaminophen. Antibiotics for bacterial infections. Myringotomy for recurrent cases.

name: Astigmatism
Symptoms: Blurred or distorted vision, eye strain, headaches,uneven curvature of cornea
General Description: A refractive error causing blurred vision due to an irregularly shaped cornea or lens.
Treatment: Corrective eyeglasses or contact lenses. Laser surgery for permanent correction.

name: Tuberous Sclerosis
Symptoms: Benign tumors in various organs, seizures, developmental delays, skin abnormalities
General Description: A genetic disorder causing benign tumors to grow in various organs.
Treatment: Regular monitoring and management of symptoms. Medications like mTOR inhibitors. Surgery for severe cases.

name: Empyema
Symptoms: Fever, chest pain, productive cough with foul-smelling or bloody sputum
General Description: Accumulation of pus in the pleural cavity, often due to pneumonia or infection.
Treatment: Antibiotics to treat the infection. Thoracentesis or chest tube drainage. Surgery for severe cases.

name: Presbycusis
Symptoms: Gradual hearing loss, difficulty hearing high-pitched sounds, speech sounds muffled or unclear
General Description: Age-related hearing loss due to gradual degeneration of auditory structures.
Treatment: Hearing aids. Assistive listening devices. Cochlear implants for severe cases.

name: Neonatal Jaundice
Symptoms: Yellowing of the skin and eyes, pale stools, dark urine
General Description: Yellowing of a newborn’s skin and eyes due to high bilirubin levels.
Treatment: Phototherapy to lower bilirubin. Exchange transfusion in severe cases. Monitoring and hydration.

name: Dislocation of the Elbow
Symptoms: Severe pain, visible deformity, swelling, inability to move the elbow, numbness or tingling in the hand/arm
General Description: Displacement of bones in the elbow joint, causing pain and deformity.
Treatment: Manual reduction to reposition the joint. Immobilization with a splint. Physical therapy after recovery.

name: Spondylosis
Symptoms: Neck or back pain, stiffness, limited range of motion, numbness or weakness in the extremities
General Description: Degenerative changes in the spine, leading to pain and stiffness.
Treatment: Physical therapy and exercises. Pain relievers or anti-inflammatory medications. Surgery in severe cases.

name: Herpangina
Symptoms: Sore throat, fever, painful sores or blisters in the mouth and throat, difficulty swallowing, loss of appetite
General Description: A viral infection causing ulcers in the mouth and throat, often in children.
Treatment: Pain relievers like acetaminophen. Adequate hydration. Supportive care to manage symptoms.

name: Poisoning due to Antidepressants
Symptoms: Nausea, vomiting, drowsiness, dizziness, confusion, seizures, changes in heart rate, low blood pressure, respiratory distress
General Description: Toxicity resulting from excessive intake of antidepressant medications.
Treatment: Gastric lavage or activated charcoal. Supportive care for symptoms. Monitoring in a medical facility.

name: Infection of Open Wound
Symptoms: Redness, swelling, warmth, pain or tenderness at the wound site, pus or drainage from the wound, fever, malaise
General Description: Infection of an open skin injury caused by bacteria or other pathogens.
Treatment: Cleaning and dressing the wound. Antibiotics if infection is severe. Surgical debridement if needed.

name: Protein Deficiency
Symptoms: Muscle wasting, fatigue, weakness, delayed wound healing, swelling of the limbs, hair loss, impaired immunity
General Description: A lack of adequate protein intake, leading to muscle wasting and weakened immunity.
Treatment: Dietary supplementation with protein-rich foods. Use of protein powders if necessary. Addressing underlying conditions.

name: Myoclonus
Symptoms: Sudden, brief muscle contractions or jerks, often affecting the arms, legs, or face
General Description: Sudden, involuntary muscle jerks, which can occur due to various neurological conditions.
Treatment: Identify and treat the underlying cause. Use medications like clonazepam or valproate to control symptoms. Adjust lifestyle factors, such as avoiding triggers like stress or caffeine. Perform deep brain stimulation for severe or treatment-resistant cases.

name: Bone Spur of the Calcaneus
Symptoms: Heel pain, especially when walking or standing, tenderness, swelling, inflammation of the surrounding tissue
General Description: Bony growth on the heel bone that may cause pain during walking or standing.
Treatment: Orthotic inserts or heel pads. Physical therapy. Pain relievers. Surgery in severe cases.

name: Von Willebrand Disease
Symptoms: Easy or excessive bruising, prolonged or excessive bleeding from cuts or injuries, frequent nosebleeds, heavy or prolonged menstrual periods, bleeding gums, blood in urine or stool
General Description: A genetic bleeding disorder caused by a deficiency or dysfunction of von Willebrand factor.
Treatment: Desmopressin to release stored von Willebrand factor. Clotting factor concentrates. Avoidance of blood-thinning medications.

name: Heart Block
Symptoms: Fatigue, dizziness, fainting, chest pain or discomfort, shortness of breath, irregular heart rhythms
General Description: Disruption in the heart's electrical system, leading to abnormal heart rhythms.
Treatment: Monitoring for mild cases. Pacemaker implantation for severe cases. Treating underlying conditions.

name: Colonic Polyp
Symptoms: Most colonic polyps do not cause symptoms. Some larger polyps or certain types may cause rectal bleeding or changes in bowel habits, such as diarrhea or constipation.
General Description: Growths on the inner lining of the colon, which may become cancerous over time.
Treatment: Removal during a colonoscopy. Regular monitoring for recurrence. Lifestyle modifications to reduce risk.

name: Hypospadias
Symptoms: Abnormal positioning of the urethral opening on the underside of the penis, penile curvature, spraying of urine, difficulty in urination
General Description: A congenital condition where the urethra opens on the underside of the penis instead of at the tip.
Treatment: Surgical correction during early childhood. Monitoring for urinary or reproductive issues.

name: Magnesium Deficiency
Symptoms: Muscle twitches or cramps, fatigue, weakness, loss of appetite, nausea, vomiting, irritability, mental confusion, irregular heartbeat, tingling or numbness, personality changes, seizures
General Description: Low magnesium levels in the body, leading to muscle cramps, fatigue, or arrhythmias.
Treatment: Magnesium supplements. Dietary intake of magnesium-rich foods. Treating underlying causes.

name: Female Infertility of Unknown Cause
Symptoms: Inability to conceive after one year of unprotected intercourse, irregular or absent menstrual cycles, hormonal imbalances, age-related factors, other
General Description: Difficulty in conceiving with no identifiable medical cause.
Treatment: Assisted reproductive techniques like IVF. Lifestyle modifications. Fertility medications.

name: Pericarditis
Symptoms: Chest pain (sharp and stabbing), worsens with deep breaths or lying down, fever
General Description: Inflammation of the pericardium, the protective sac around the heart.
Treatment: NSAIDs or corticosteroids. Colchicine to reduce recurrence. Pericardiocentesis for fluid removal.

name: Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)
Symptoms: Inattention, hyperactivity, impulsivity
General Description: A neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by inattention, hyperactivity, and impulsivity.
Treatment: Stimulant medications like methylphenidate. Behavioral therapy. Organizational support strategies.

name: Neuromyelitis Optica
Symptoms: Optic neuritis (vision loss, pain with eye movement), transverse myelitis (weakness, numbness, or paralysis of the limbs, loss of bladder or bowel control)
General Description: An autoimmune disorder affecting the optic nerves and spinal cord
Treatment: Immunosuppressive medications. Corticosteroids during acute attacks. Plasma exchange for severe relapses.

name: Pulmonic Valve Disease
Symptoms: Fatigue, shortness of breath, chest pain or discomfort, heart palpitations, fainting or lightheadedness, swollen legs or ankles
General Description: A condition affecting the pulmonary valve of the heart, leading to improper blood flow.
Treatment: Balloon valvuloplasty for stenosis. Valve replacement surgery. Treating associated heart conditions.

name: Tietze Syndrome
Symptoms: Chest pain, swelling and tenderness of the cartilage connecting the ribs to the breastbone
General Description: Inflammation of the costal cartilage, causing chest pain and swelling.
Treatment: NSAIDs or pain relievers. Ice or heat application. Physical therapy for persistent pain.

name: Cranial Nerve Palsy
Symptoms: Depends on the specific cranial nerve involved; symptoms can include vision changes, eye movement abnormalities, facial weakness or paralysis, difficulty swallowing or speaking, loss of sensation in the face or other areas
General Description: Dysfunction of one or more cranial nerves, leading to neurological deficits.
Treatment: Addressing underlying causes like infection or trauma. Physical therapy. Surgery for compressive lesions.

name: Conversion Disorder
Symptoms: Neurological symptoms that cannot be explained by a medical condition or injury, such as paralysis, blindness, seizures, or difficulty speaking
General Description: A psychological condition where emotional distress manifests as physical symptoms.
Treatment: Psychotherapy, including cognitive-behavioral therapy. Stress management techniques. Supportive care for physical symptoms.

name: Complex Regional Pain Syndrome
Symptoms: Severe and chronic pain, often in the limbs, with associated swelling, changes in skin color or temperature, abnormal sweating, limited range of motion
General Description: A chronic pain condition typically following an injury, affecting a limb.
Treatment: Physical therapy. Medications like pain relievers and nerve blocks. Psychological support.

name: Otosclerosis
Symptoms: Hearing loss (gradual and progressive), tinnitus (ringing in the ears), dizziness or balance problems
General Description: Abnormal bone growth in the middle ear, leading to hearing loss.
Treatment: Hearing aids. Surgical procedures like stapedectomy. Fluoride therapy in some cases.

name: Hypothyroidism
Symptoms: Fatigue, weight gain, sensitivity to cold, dry skin, constipation, depression, muscle weakness, elevated cholesterol levels
General Description: A condition where the thyroid gland does not produce enough thyroid hormone.
Treatment: Levothyroxine hormone replacement therapy. Regular monitoring of thyroid levels.

name: Primary Insomnia
Symptoms: Difficulty falling asleep or staying asleep, daytime sleepiness, irritability, difficulty concentrating
General Description: Difficulty initiating or maintaining sleep not attributed to other conditions.
Treatment: Cognitive-behavioral therapy for insomnia. Sleep hygiene improvements. Short-term use of sleep aids if necessary.

name: Lice
Symptoms: Itching and visible presence of lice or nits (eggs) in the hair
General Description: Infestation of the scalp or body by parasitic insects causing itching and irritation.
Treatment: Over-the-counter or prescription lice shampoos. Fine-toothed combing to remove nits. Cleaning and treating affected clothing and bedding.

name: Vitamin B12 Deficiency
Symptoms: Fatigue, weakness, pale skin, shortness of breath, tingling or numbness in the hands and feet, balance problems, sore tongue
General Description: A condition caused by insufficient vitamin B12, which is essential for red blood cell production, nerve function, and DNA synthesis. Common symptoms include fatigue, weakness, numbness, and cognitive disturbances.
Treatment: Vitamin B12 supplementation via oral, sublingual, or injectable forms. Dietary changes to include B12-rich foods like meat, fish, eggs, and dairy. Treating underlying causes (e.g., pernicious anemia or malabsorption disorders).

name: Vulvodynia
Symptoms: Persistent pain or discomfort in the vulva, burning, stinging, rawness, itching
General Description: Chronic vulvar pain or discomfort without an identifiable cause, often described as burning, stinging, or rawness.
Treatment: Topical anesthetics (e.g., lidocaine). Physical therapy for pelvic floor muscles. Oral medications such as tricyclic antidepressants or anticonvulsants. Cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT). Lifestyle modifications, including avoiding irritants.

name: Endometriosis
Symptoms: Pelvic pain (during menstruation, intercourse, or bowel movements), heavy menstrual bleeding, infertility
General Description: A condition in which tissue similar to the uterine lining grows outside the uterus, causing pain, heavy menstrual bleeding, and fertility issues.
Treatment: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs). Hormonal therapies like oral contraceptives, progestins, or gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) agonists. Surgical removal of endometrial tissue. Assisted reproductive techniques for infertility.

name: Vasculitis
Symptoms: Inflammation of blood vessels leading to various symptoms depending on the affected organs, including rash, fever, fatigue, muscle and joint pain, shortness of breath, weight loss
General Description: Inflammation of blood vessels, which can restrict blood flow and damage organs and tissues. It can be primary or secondary to other diseases.
Treatment: Corticosteroids (e.g., prednisone). Immunosuppressive drugs (e.g., methotrexate, cyclophosphamide). Biologic therapies (e.g., rituximab). Treating underlying infections or triggers.

name: Concussion
Symptoms: Headache, dizziness, nausea or vomiting, confusion, memory problems, sensitivity to light or noise, mood changes
General Description: A mild traumatic brain injury caused by a blow to the head, leading to symptoms such as headache, confusion, memory issues, and dizziness.
Treatment: Rest and gradual return to activities. Pain management with acetaminophen or NSAIDs. Monitoring for worsening symptoms and seeking medical evaluation if needed.

name: Oral Leukoplakia
Symptoms: White patches or plaques in the mouth, often on the tongue or inside of the cheeks, that cannot be scraped off
General Description: White patches on the mucous membranes of the mouth, potentially precancerous, often linked to tobacco or alcohol use.
Treatment: Eliminating risk factors like smoking and alcohol. Regular monitoring for changes. Surgical removal of suspicious patches. Laser therapy or cryotherapy for larger lesions.

name: Chronic Kidney Disease
Symptoms: Fatigue, swelling of the legs or ankles, decreased appetite, difficulty concentrating, increased urination or urine changes, blood in urine, high blood pressure
General Description: Progressive loss of kidney function over time, leading to waste accumulation in the body, fluid imbalance, and potential organ damage.
Treatment: Lifestyle modifications, including a low-sodium, kidney-friendly diet. Medications to control blood pressure, blood sugar, and cholesterol. Dialysis in advanced stages. Kidney transplantation.

name: Bladder Disorder
Symptoms: Frequent urination, urgency, pelvic pain
General Description: A broad category encompassing conditions like overactive bladder, interstitial cystitis, or urinary incontinence.
Treatment: Behavioral therapies such as bladder training. Medications like anticholinergics or beta-3 adrenergic agonists. Pelvic floor exercises. Surgery for severe cases.

name: Chorioretinitis
Symptoms: Eye pain, blurred vision, sensitivity to light
General Description: Inflammation of the choroid and retina, often due to infections like toxoplasmosis or autoimmune conditions, causing vision disturbances.
Treatment: Antibiotics or antivirals for infectious causes. Corticosteroids to reduce inflammation. Immunosuppressive therapy for autoimmune-related cases.

name: Priapism
Symptoms: Persistent, painful erection
General Description: A prolonged and painful erection unrelated to sexual stimulation, potentially causing permanent damage to erectile tissue.
Treatment: Aspiration of blood from the penis. Intracavernosal injection of vasoconstrictive agents (e.g., phenylephrine). Surgery to relieve trapped blood in severe cases. Treating underlying conditions like sickle cell anemia.

name: Myositis
Symptoms: Muscle weakness, pain, inflammation
General Description: Inflammation of the muscles, which can result from autoimmune disorders, infections, or drug reactions, leading to weakness and fatigue.
Treatment: Corticosteroids. Immunosuppressive drugs (e.g., methotrexate, azathioprine). Physical therapy. Treating underlying infections or triggers.

name: Mononucleosis
Symptoms: Fatigue, sore throat, swollen lymph nodes
General Description: A viral infection commonly caused by the Epstein-Barr virus (EBV), characterized by fatigue, fever, sore throat, and swollen lymph nodes.
Treatment: Rest and hydration. Pain relief with acetaminophen or NSAIDs. Avoiding strenuous activity to prevent spleen rupture. Symptomatic treatment.

name: Neuralgia
Symptoms: Sharp, shooting pain along the affected nerve
General Description: Intense nerve pain often caused by damage or irritation of nerves, such as trigeminal neuralgia or postherpetic neuralgia.
Treatment: Anticonvulsants (e.g., carbamazepine, gabapentin). Topical treatments like lidocaine patches or capsaicin cream. Surgery for refractory cases. Nerve blocks.

name: Polycystic Kidney Disease
Symptoms: Abdominal pain, high blood pressure, kidney cysts
General Description: A genetic disorder causing multiple cysts in the kidneys, leading to impaired kidney function and hypertension.
Treatment: Blood pressure control with ACE inhibitors or ARBs. Pain management. Treating urinary tract infections. Dialysis or kidney transplantation in advanced stages.

name: Bipolar Disorder
Symptoms: Mood swings, manic episodes, depressive episodes
General Description: A mental health condition characterized by mood swings between manic and depressive episodes.
Treatment: Mood stabilizers (e.g., lithium). Antipsychotic medications. Antidepressants in combination with mood stabilizers. Psychotherapy, including CBT. Lifestyle modifications for stress management.

name: Amyloidosis
Symptoms: Fatigue, weight loss, organ dysfunction
General Description: A rare condition characterized by abnormal protein (amyloid) deposits in tissues and organs, impairing their function.
Treatment: Chemotherapy for AL amyloidosis. Targeted treatments like tafamidis for ATTR amyloidosis. Organ-specific treatments (e.g., dialysis for kidney involvement). Stem cell transplantation in select cases.

name: Chronic Inflammatory Demyelinating Polyneuropathy (CIDP)
Symptoms: Weakness, numbness, tingling in limbs
General Description: A rare autoimmune disorder causing inflammation and damage to the myelin sheath of peripheral nerves, leading to progressive weakness and sensory impairment.
Treatment: Corticosteroids (e.g., prednisone). Intravenous immunoglobulin (IVIG). Plasma exchange (plasmapheresis). Immunosuppressive drugs (e.g., azathioprine or rituximab). Physical therapy for rehabilitation.

name: Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD)
Symptoms: Heartburn, acid reflux, chest pain
General Description: A digestive disorder where stomach acid flows back into the esophagus, causing symptoms like heartburn, regurgitation, and chest discomfort.
Treatment: Lifestyle modifications (e.g., weight loss, avoiding trigger foods). Antacids for symptom relief. H2 receptor blockers (e.g., ranitidine). Proton pump inhibitors (PPIs, e.g., omeprazole). Surgery (e.g., fundoplication) for severe or refractory cases.

name: Vitreous Hemorrhage
Symptoms: Floaters in vision, blurry vision, eye pain
General Description: Bleeding into the vitreous humor of the eye, often caused by trauma, retinal tears, or diabetic retinopathy, leading to vision loss or floaters.
Treatment: Observation if the hemorrhage is minor and resolves spontaneously. Laser therapy or cryotherapy for retinal tears. Vitrectomy surgery for severe or persistent cases.

name: Antimicrobial Drugs Poisoning
Symptoms: Nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, neurological symptoms
General Description: Toxic effects from excessive or inappropriate use of antimicrobial drugs, causing symptoms like nausea, vomiting, organ damage, or allergic reactions.
Treatment: Immediate cessation of the offending drug. Supportive care, including hydration and electrolyte management. Administration of activated charcoal if ingestion is recent. Specific antidotes or treatments based on the antimicrobial agent involved.

name: Scleroderma
Symptoms: Thickening of the skin, Raynaud's phenomenon
General Description: A chronic autoimmune disease causing hardening and thickening of the skin and connective tissues, potentially affecting internal organs.
Treatment: Immunosuppressive medications (e.g., methotrexate, mycophenolate mofetil). Vasodilators for Raynaud's phenomenon. Proton pump inhibitors for gastrointestinal symptoms. Physical therapy. Organ-specific management.

name: Myasthenia Gravis
Symptoms: Muscle weakness, fatigue, difficulty speaking
General Description: A chronic autoimmune disorder causing weakness in voluntary muscles, particularly after activity, due to impaired communication at the neuromuscular junction.
Treatment: Anticholinesterase medications (e.g., pyridostigmine). Corticosteroids or other immunosuppressive drugs. Plasma exchange or IVIG for severe cases. Thymectomy surgery if a thymoma is present.

name: Hypoglycemia
Symptoms: Shaking, dizziness, confusion, sweating
General Description: Low blood sugar levels, often due to diabetes medication, prolonged fasting, or excessive physical activity, causing symptoms like shakiness, confusion, and sweating.
Treatment: Immediate consumption of glucose (e.g., glucose tablets, juice). Adjusting insulin or diabetes medications. Addressing underlying causes. Glucagon injection for severe cases.

name: Idiopathic Absence of Menstruation
Symptoms: Lack of menstrual periods
General Description: The absence of menstrual periods without a clear cause, potentially linked to hormonal imbalances, stress, or structural issues.
Treatment: Hormone replacement therapy for deficiencies. Treating underlying conditions like polycystic ovary syndrome or thyroid disorders. Lifestyle modifications, such as reducing stress or achieving a healthy weight.

name: Dislocation of the Ankle
Symptoms: Swelling, severe pain, inability to bear weight
General Description: A displacement of the bones in the ankle joint, usually caused by trauma, often accompanied by ligament damage.
Treatment: Reduction to realign the joint. Immobilization with a splint or cast. Pain management with NSAIDs. Physical therapy for recovery. Surgery for severe ligament or bone damage.

name: Carbon Monoxide Poisoning
Symptoms: Headache, dizziness, nausea, confusion
General Description: A potentially life-threatening condition caused by inhaling carbon monoxide gas, leading to oxygen deprivation in tissues and organs.
Treatment: Immediate removal from exposure to carbon monoxide. Administration of 100% oxygen via a mask. Hyperbaric oxygen therapy for severe cases. Monitoring and supportive care for complications.

name: Panic Attack
Symptoms: Chest pain, shortness of breath, palpitations
General Description: Sudden and intense episodes of fear or anxiety, often accompanied by physical symptoms like palpitations, shortness of breath, and dizziness.
Treatment: Cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT). Medications such as selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs). Breathing exercises and relaxation techniques. Benzodiazepines for short-term relief in acute situations.

name: Plantar Fasciitis
Symptoms: Heel pain, tenderness, difficulty walking
General Description: Inflammation of the plantar fascia, causing heel pain, especially in the morning or after prolonged activity.
Treatment: Rest and ice application. Stretching exercises for the foot and calf. Orthotic inserts or supportive footwear. NSAIDs for pain relief. Corticosteroid injections for severe cases. Physical therapy or shockwave therapy.

name: Hyperopia
Symptoms: Difficulty seeing objects up close, blurred vision when focusing on near objects
General Description: A refractive error where distant objects are seen more clearly than near ones, due to the eye focusing light behind the retina.
Treatment: Corrective lenses (glasses or contact lenses). Refractive surgery (e.g., LASIK or PRK). Regular eye exams to monitor changes.

name: Sedatives Poisoning
Symptoms: Drowsiness, confusion, slowed breathing
General Description: Overdose or toxic exposure to sedative medications, leading to drowsiness, respiratory depression, and impaired motor function.
Treatment: Activated charcoal if ingestion is recent. Supportive care, including airway management and monitoring. Flumazenil for benzodiazepine overdose. Hospitalization for severe cases.

name: Pemphigus
Symptoms: Painful blisters on the skin and mucous membranes
General Description: A group of rare autoimmune disorders causing blistering of the skin and mucous membranes, often painful and potentially life-threatening.
Treatment: Corticosteroids (e.g., prednisone). Immunosuppressive drugs (e.g., azathioprine, rituximab). Antibiotics or antifungals for secondary infections. Wound care and supportive therapy.

name: Peyronie Disease
Symptoms: Curvature of the penis, pain during erections
General Description: A condition characterized by fibrous scar tissue developing in the penis, causing curvature, pain, and difficulty with erections.
Treatment: Oral medications such as pentoxifylline. Intralesional injections (e.g., collagenase clostridium histolyticum). Stretching devices or penile traction therapy. Surgery for severe cases.

name: Hiatal Hernia
Symptoms: Heartburn, chest pain, difficulty swallowing
General Description: A condition where part of the stomach bulges through the diaphragm into the chest cavity, often causing heartburn and reflux.
Treatment: Lifestyle modifications, such as eating smaller meals and avoiding trigger foods. Proton pump inhibitors (PPIs) or H2 blockers. Surgery (e.g., fundoplication) for large or symptomatic hernias.

name: Extrapyramidal Effect of Drugs
Symptoms: Muscle stiffness, tremors, involuntary movements
General Description: Side effects caused by medications, particularly antipsychotics, leading to involuntary movements, tremors, rigidity, or restlessness.
Treatment: Discontinuation or adjustment of the offending drug. Administration of anticholinergic agents (e.g., benztropine). Dopamine agonists or benzodiazepines for symptom relief.

name: Meniere Disease
Symptoms: Vertigo, hearing loss, tinnitus, ear fullness
General Description: A disorder of the inner ear causing episodes of vertigo, hearing loss, tinnitus, and a feeling of ear fullness.
Treatment: Low-sodium diet. Diuretics to reduce fluid buildup. Vestibular suppressants (e.g., meclizine). Steroid injections into the middle ear. Surgery for refractory cases.

name: Anal Fissure
Symptoms: Pain during bowel movements, rectal bleeding
General Description: A small tear in the lining of the anus, often causing pain and bleeding during bowel movements.
Treatment: Increased dietary fiber and fluids to soften stools. Topical anesthetics for pain relief. Nitroglycerin ointment or calcium channel blockers to relax anal muscles. Surgery (e.g., lateral internal sphincterotomy) for chronic cases.

name: Chronic Otitis Media
Symptoms: Ear pain, hearing loss, recurrent ear infections
General Description: Persistent inflammation or infection of the middle ear, often leading to hearing loss, drainage, or complications.
Treatment: Antibiotic drops or oral antibiotics. Myringotomy with or without tympanostomy tubes. Surgery to repair eardrum or remove infected tissue (e.g., mastoidectomy).

name: Hirschsprung Disease
Symptoms: Chronic constipation, abdominal distension, failure to pass meconium (in newborns)
General Description: A congenital condition where missing nerve cells in parts of the colon cause difficulty in passing stool, leading to severe constipation or intestinal blockage.
Treatment: Surgical removal of the affected portion of the bowel. Temporary colostomy in severe cases. Monitoring for complications like enterocolitis.

name: Polymyalgia Rheumatica
Symptoms: Muscle pain and stiffness, joint pain, fatigue
General Description: An inflammatory disorder causing muscle pain and stiffness, especially in the shoulders and hips, commonly associated with giant cell arteritis.
Treatment: Low-dose corticosteroids (e.g., prednisone). Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) for mild cases. Physical therapy to maintain mobility.

name: Lymphedema
Symptoms: Swelling in arms or legs, feeling of heaviness or tightness
General Description: Swelling due to lymphatic system blockage, often occurring in the arms or legs after surgery, radiation, or infection.
Treatment: Compression therapy with bandages or garments. Manual lymphatic drainage massage. Exercise to promote lymph flow. Surgery in severe or refractory cases.

name: Bladder Cancer
Symptoms: Blood in urine, frequent urination, pelvic pain
General Description: A malignancy of the bladder lining, commonly presenting with blood in urine, frequent urination, or pelvic pain.
Treatment: Transurethral resection of bladder tumor (TURBT). Intravesical therapy (e.g., BCG or chemotherapy). Radical cystectomy for advanced cases. Systemic chemotherapy or immunotherapy for metastatic disease.

name: Acute Bronchospasm
Symptoms: Wheezing, shortness of breath, chest tightness
General Description: Sudden constriction of the airways, causing wheezing, shortness of breath, and chest tightness, often triggered by asthma or allergies.
Treatment: Inhaled bronchodilators (e.g., albuterol). Corticosteroids to reduce inflammation. Oxygen therapy if needed. Addressing and removing triggers.

name: Acute Glaucoma
Symptoms: Severe eye pain, blurred vision, halos around lights
General Description: A sudden increase in intraocular pressure, often due to angle-closure glaucoma, causing severe eye pain, redness, and vision loss.
Treatment: Medications to lower intraocular pressure (e.g., acetazolamide, beta-blockers). Laser therapy or surgical procedures (e.g., laser iridotomy). Emergency intervention to prevent permanent vision loss.

name: Dislocation of the Patella
Symptoms: Knee pain, swelling, inability to straighten the leg
General Description: Displacement of the kneecap from its normal position, often caused by trauma or congenital ligament laxity.
Treatment: Manual reduction of the dislocation. Immobilization with a brace. Physical therapy to strengthen supporting muscles. Surgery for recurrent dislocations or ligament damage.

name: Sciatica
Symptoms: Sharp pain, tingling, or numbness that radiates from the lower back through the hips and down the leg
General Description: Pain radiating along the sciatic nerve, often due to compression or inflammation during pregnancy.
Treatment: Gentle stretches and physical therapy. Heat or cold packs for pain relief. Pain relievers if prescribed.

name: Hypercalcemia
Symptoms: Fatigue, nausea, excessive thirst, kidney stones
General Description: Elevated calcium levels in the blood, often due to hyperparathyroidism, malignancy, or excessive vitamin D intake, causing symptoms like fatigue, nausea, and confusion.
Treatment: Hydration with intravenous fluids. Bisphosphonates or calcitonin to reduce calcium levels. Treating underlying causes (e.g., parathyroid surgery for hyperparathyroidism).

name: Stress Incontinence
Symptoms: Unintentional urine leakage during physical activity
General Description: Involuntary leakage of urine during activities that increase abdominal pressure, such as coughing, sneezing, or lifting.
Treatment: Pelvic floor exercises (Kegels). Vaginal pessaries. Medications like duloxetine. Surgery (e.g., midurethral sling) for severe cases.

name: Benign Kidney Cyst
Symptoms: Abdominal or flank pain, blood in urine, frequent urination
General Description: Fluid-filled sacs in the kidney that are noncancerous and usually asymptomatic but can occasionally cause pain or complications.
Treatment: Observation if asymptomatic. Aspiration and sclerotherapy for symptomatic cysts. Surgical removal for large or complicated cysts.

name: Hydrocele of the Testicle
Symptoms: Swelling of the scrotum
General Description: A fluid-filled sac around a testicle, leading to painless swelling in the scrotum, often congenital or caused by injury or infection.
