Treatment: Observation if asymptomatic. Aspiration of fluid. Surgical repair (hydrocelectomy) for persistent or symptomatic cases.

name: Hirsutism
Symptoms: Excessive hair growth in women
General Description: Excessive hair growth in women in a male pattern (e.g., on the face, chest, or back) often due to hormonal imbalances like polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).
Treatment: Oral contraceptives to regulate hormones. Anti-androgen medications (e.g., spironolactone). Hair removal techniques (e.g., laser therapy, electrolysis). Treating underlying conditions.

name: Hydronephrosis
Symptoms: Flank pain, urinary frequency, swelling in the abdomen
General Description: Swelling of a kidney due to urine buildup caused by obstruction or reflux, potentially leading to pain and infection.
Treatment: Relieving the obstruction with stents or catheters. Surgery to correct anatomical issues (e.g., ureteropelvic junction repair). Treating underlying causes, such as kidney stones or infections.

name: Diverticulosis
Symptoms: Abdominal pain, bloating, changes in bowel movements
General Description: Small, bulging pouches (diverticula) in the colon wall, usually asymptomatic but sometimes causing mild cramping or bloating.
Treatment: High-fiber diet to prevent symptoms. Increased water intake. Monitoring for complications like diverticulitis.

name: Pain after an Operation
Symptoms: Surgical site pain, discomfort, swelling
General Description: Postoperative pain resulting from tissue damage, inflammation, or nerve irritation.
Treatment: Pain management with acetaminophen, NSAIDs, or opioids. Ice or heat application. Physical therapy if needed. Nerve blocks or epidural anesthesia for severe pain.

name: Huntington Disease
Symptoms: Motor, cognitive, and psychiatric symptoms
General Description: A genetic neurodegenerative disorder causing progressive movement issues, cognitive decline, and psychiatric symptoms.
Treatment: Symptom management with medications like tetrabenazine for chorea. Antidepressants or antipsychotics for mood disorders. Supportive therapies, including physical and occupational therapy. Genetic counseling for families.

name: West Nile Virus
Symptoms: Fever, headache, body aches, rash
General Description: A viral infection transmitted by mosquitoes, often asymptomatic but sometimes causing fever, headache, and severe neurological symptoms.
Treatment: Supportive care, including hydration and pain relief. Hospitalization and intravenous fluids for severe cases. Monitoring for complications like meningitis or encephalitis.

name: Lymphoma
Symptoms: Swollen lymph nodes, unexplained weight loss, fatigue
General Description: A type of blood cancer affecting lymphocytes, categorized as Hodgkin or non-Hodgkin lymphoma, often presenting with swollen lymph nodes, fatigue, and fever.
Treatment: Chemotherapy (e.g., CHOP regimen). Radiation therapy for localized disease. Targeted therapies (e.g., rituximab). Stem cell transplantation for refractory cases.

name: Dermatitis due to Sun Exposure
Symptoms: Redness, itching, rash, blistering
General Description: Inflammation of the skin caused by prolonged UV exposure, leading to redness, pain, and sometimes blistering.
Treatment: Cooling measures (e.g., cold compresses). Topical corticosteroids to reduce inflammation. Oral NSAIDs for pain. Sun protection to prevent future episodes.

name: Anemia due to Chronic Kidney Disease
Symptoms: Fatigue, weakness, pale skin
General Description: A decrease in red blood cell count due to insufficient erythropoietin production by damaged kidneys.
Treatment: Erythropoiesis-stimulating agents (e.g., epoetin alfa). Iron supplements (oral or intravenous). Blood transfusions in severe cases. Treating underlying kidney disease.

name: Injury to Internal Organ
Symptoms: Abdominal pain, bleeding, organ dysfunction
General Description: Damage to organs like the liver, spleen, or kidneys due to trauma, causing pain, bleeding, or loss of function.
Treatment: Monitoring and supportive care for minor injuries. Surgery (e.g., laparotomy) for severe injuries or bleeding. Blood transfusions if significant blood loss occurs.

name: Scleritis
Symptoms: Eye redness, severe eye pain, blurred vision
General Description: Inflammation of the sclera (white of the eye), causing severe pain, redness, and potential vision impairment, often linked to autoimmune diseases.
Treatment: NSAIDs for mild cases. Corticosteroids (oral or topical) for moderate cases. Immunosuppressive drugs (e.g., methotrexate) for severe or autoimmune-associated scleritis.

name: Pterygium
Symptoms: Growth on the conjunctiva (white part of the eye)
General Description: A benign growth of conjunctival tissue on the cornea, often related to UV exposure, causing irritation and vision issues.
Treatment: Lubricating eye drops or gels for mild cases. Topical corticosteroids for inflammation. Surgical removal if vision is impaired or irritation is severe.

name: Fungal Infection of the Skin
Symptoms: Rash, itching, redness, peeling skin
General Description: Infection of the skin caused by fungi, such as dermatophytes or yeast, leading to redness, itching, scaling, or lesions.
Treatment: Topical antifungals (e.g., clotrimazole, terbinafine). Oral antifungals (e.g., fluconazole, itraconazole) for widespread or severe cases. Maintaining skin dryness and hygiene.

name: Insulin Overdose
Symptoms: Low blood sugar (hypoglycemia) symptoms (e.g., confusion, sweating)
General Description: Excessive insulin administration causes hypoglycemia, leading to symptoms like sweating, confusion, tremors, or even seizures and loss of consciousness.
Treatment: Immediate consumption of glucose or sugary foods if conscious. Intravenous dextrose in severe cases. Glucagon injection for unconscious patients. Monitoring blood glucose levels and adjusting insulin dosages.

name: Syndrome of Inappropriate Secretion of ADH (SIADH)
Symptoms: Excessively concentrated urine, low blood sodium levels
General Description: A condition characterized by excessive antidiuretic hormone (ADH) secretion, leading to water retention and low sodium levels (hyponatremia).
Treatment: Fluid restriction. Administration of hypertonic saline in severe hyponatremia. Vasopressin receptor antagonists (e.g., tolvaptan). Treating underlying causes (e.g., tumors or medications).

name: Premenstrual Tension Syndrome
Symptoms: Mood swings, bloating, breast tenderness, irritability
General Description: A group of emotional and physical symptoms occurring before menstruation, including mood swings, bloating, and fatigue.
Treatment: Lifestyle changes, including regular exercise and a balanced diet. NSAIDs for pain. Hormonal contraceptives to regulate cycles. SSRIs for severe mood symptoms.

name: Orbital Cellulitis
Symptoms: Eye pain, swelling, redness, vision changes
General Description: A serious infection of the tissues surrounding the eye, often caused by sinus infections, leading to swelling, pain, and potential vision loss.
Treatment: Intravenous antibiotics (e.g., ceftriaxone, vancomycin). Surgical drainage for abscesses. Close monitoring to prevent complications like vision loss or brain infection.

name: Injury to the Leg
Symptoms: Pain, swelling, bruising, difficulty walking
General Description: Trauma to the leg can result in fractures, sprains, contusions, or soft tissue injuries, causing pain, swelling, and functional limitations.
Treatment: Rest, ice, compression, and elevation (RICE) for minor injuries. Pain management with NSAIDs. Surgery or immobilization for fractures or severe injuries. Physical therapy for rehabilitation.

name: Hepatic Encephalopathy
Symptoms: Confusion, forgetfulness, personality changes, tremors
General Description: A decline in brain function due to liver dysfunction, causing confusion, altered consciousness, and neurological symptoms.
Treatment: Lactulose to reduce ammonia levels. Antibiotics like rifaximin to decrease gut bacteria producing ammonia. Addressing underlying liver disease or triggers (e.g., infections, dehydration).

name: Bone Cancer
Symptoms: Bone pain, fractures, fatigue, unexplained weight loss
General Description: A malignant tumor in the bone, such as osteosarcoma or chondrosarcoma, causing pain, swelling, and fractures.
Treatment: Surgery to remove the tumor. Chemotherapy (e.g., methotrexate, doxorubicin). Radiation therapy. Targeted therapies for specific cancer types.

name: Leishmaniasis
Symptoms: Skin sores, fever, weight loss, enlarged spleen or liver
General Description: A parasitic disease caused by Leishmania, transmitted by sandfly bites, presenting as cutaneous sores, mucosal damage, or visceral organ involvement.
Treatment: Antiparasitic medications (e.g., amphotericin B, miltefosine). Topical or systemic treatments for cutaneous forms. Supportive care for severe cases.

name: Chagas Disease
Symptoms: Fever, fatigue, body aches, heart and digestive problems
General Description: A parasitic infection caused by Trypanosoma cruzi, transmitted by triatomine bugs, leading to acute symptoms and chronic cardiac or gastrointestinal complications.
Treatment: Antiparasitic drugs (e.g., benznidazole, nifurtimox). Management of complications like heart failure or arrhythmias. Monitoring for disease progression.

name: Syringomyelia
Symptoms: Muscle weakness, loss of sensation, chronic pain
General Description: A fluid-filled cyst (syrinx) forms in the spinal cord, causing pain, weakness, and sensory deficits.
Treatment: Surgical drainage of the syrinx. Addressing underlying causes (e.g., Chiari malformation). Physical therapy for symptom management.

name: Pulmonary Fibrosis
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, dry cough, fatigue
General Description: A chronic condition characterized by scarring of lung tissue, leading to progressive shortness of breath and reduced lung function.
Treatment: Antifibrotic medications (e.g., pirfenidone, nintedanib). Oxygen therapy. Lung transplantation for advanced disease. Managing underlying causes or triggers.

name: Mitral Valve Disease
Symptoms: Fatigue, shortness of breath, heart palpitations
General Description: A condition affecting the mitral valve, such as stenosis or regurgitation, causing symptoms like fatigue, shortness of breath, and palpitations.
Treatment: Medications like diuretics, beta-blockers, or anticoagulants. Mitral valve repair or replacement surgery. Percutaneous mitral balloon valvuloplasty for stenosis.

name: Parkinson Disease
Symptoms: Tremors, stiffness, slowness of movement
General Description: A neurodegenerative disorder characterized by tremors, rigidity, bradykinesia, and postural instability due to dopamine deficiency.
Treatment: Dopaminergic medications (e.g., levodopa, carbidopa). MAO-B inhibitors (e.g., selegiline). Deep brain stimulation for refractory cases. Physical and occupational therapy.

name: Gout
Symptoms: Intense joint pain, swelling, redness
General Description: A form of arthritis caused by uric acid crystal buildup in joints, leading to sudden, severe pain and swelling, often in the big toe.
Treatment: NSAIDs (e.g., ibuprofen). Colchicine to reduce inflammation. Corticosteroids for severe attacks. Long-term uric acid-lowering therapy (e.g., allopurinol, febuxostat).

name: Otitis Media
Symptoms: Ear pain, fever, fluid drainage from the ear
General Description: Inflammation or infection of the middle ear, common in children, causing ear pain, fever, and hearing loss.
Treatment: Observation for mild cases. Antibiotics (e.g., amoxicillin) for bacterial infections. Myringotomy with tympanostomy tube placement for recurrent cases.

name: Myelodysplastic Syndrome
Symptoms: Fatigue, frequent infections, easy bruising or bleeding
General Description: A group of disorders caused by poorly formed or dysfunctional blood cells in the bone marrow, leading to anemia, infections, and bleeding.
Treatment: Blood transfusions to manage anemia. Erythropoiesis-stimulating agents (e.g., epoetin alfa). Chemotherapy (e.g., azacitidine, decitabine). Bone marrow or stem cell transplantation for eligible patients.

name: Fracture of the Shoulder
Symptoms: Shoulder pain, swelling, limited range of motion
General Description: A break in the bones of the shoulder (clavicle, scapula, or proximal humerus), causing pain, swelling, and difficulty moving the arm.
Treatment: Immobilization with a sling or brace. Pain management with NSAIDs or acetaminophen. Physical therapy for rehabilitation. Surgery for severe or displaced fractures.

name: Acute Kidney Injury
Symptoms: Decreased urine output, fluid retention, fatigue
General Description: A sudden loss of kidney function, leading to an accumulation of waste products in the blood and disturbances in electrolyte balance.
Treatment: Addressing underlying causes (e.g., dehydration, infections, toxins). Intravenous fluids for volume depletion. Diuretics for fluid overload. Dialysis in severe cases.

name: Threatened Pregnancy
Symptoms: Vaginal bleeding, abdominal cramps, pelvic pain
General Description: Vaginal bleeding during the first 20 weeks of pregnancy, suggesting a risk of miscarriage but with a viable fetus on ultrasound.
Treatment: Bed rest or activity modification. Progesterone supplementation in some cases. Avoidance of heavy lifting or stress. Close monitoring with ultrasound and blood tests.

name: Intracranial Abscess
Symptoms: Headache, fever, neurological deficits
General Description: A localized collection of pus in the brain caused by infection, leading to headaches, fever, neurological symptoms, or seizures.
Treatment: Intravenous antibiotics (e.g., ceftriaxone, metronidazole). Surgical drainage for large or refractory abscesses. Anticonvulsants if seizures occur. Management of the primary source of infection.

name: Gum Disease
Symptoms: Swollen, red, tender gums, bleeding gums
General Description: Inflammation or infection of the gums, often caused by poor oral hygiene, leading to redness, swelling, and bleeding.
Treatment: Practice proper oral hygiene, including brushing and flossing. Use antimicrobial mouthwashes. Perform professional dental cleaning or scaling. Consider surgery for advanced cases (e.g., flap surgery or bone grafts).

name: Open Wound from Surgical Incision
Symptoms: Redness, swelling, discharge from the wound
General Description: A wound resulting from a surgical procedure, which requires proper care to prevent infection and promote healing.
Treatment: Keep the wound clean and dry. Use prescribed antibiotics if signs of infection are present. Apply wound dressings as instructed. Remove sutures or staples per medical advice.

name: Gastrointestinal Hemorrhage
Symptoms: Abdominal pain, vomiting blood, bloody or black stools
General Description: Bleeding in the gastrointestinal tract, which may cause symptoms like vomiting blood or black stools.
Treatment: Perform endoscopic procedures to identify and treat the bleeding source. Administer blood transfusions if needed. Use proton pump inhibitors for ulcers. Perform surgery for severe or unmanageable bleeding.

name: Seborrheic Dermatitis
Symptoms: Red, itchy, and oily patches of skin, dandruff, flaky scalp
General Description: A chronic skin condition causing red, scaly, and itchy patches, often in oily areas like the scalp and face.
Treatment: Use medicated shampoos containing ketoconazole or selenium sulfide. Apply topical corticosteroids or antifungal creams. Maintain regular skin hygiene.

name: Drug Abuse (Methamphetamine)
Symptoms: Increased energy and alertness, decreased appetite, rapid heartbeat
General Description: Abuse of methamphetamine, a stimulant drug, leading to addiction and severe health consequences, including dental decay, weight loss, and mood changes.
Treatment: Engage in behavioral therapy and counseling. Use medication-assisted treatment for withdrawal symptoms. Provide supportive care for physical health issues.

name: Torticollis
Symptoms: Neck pain, stiffness, and abnormal head positioning
General Description: A condition causing the neck to twist abnormally, resulting in pain and restricted movement.
Treatment: Perform physical therapy and stretching exercises. Use muscle relaxants or pain relievers. Consider botulinum toxin injections for severe cases. Perform surgery if conservative treatments fail.

name: Antihypertensives Poisoning
Symptoms: Dizziness, low blood pressure, slow heart rate, nausea, vomiting
General Description: Overdose of antihypertensive medications leading to dangerously low blood pressure, dizziness, or organ damage.
Treatment: Administer activated charcoal if within a few hours of ingestion. Provide intravenous fluids to maintain blood pressure. Use vasopressors or antidotes like calcium gluconate for specific drugs.

name: Tension Headache
Symptoms: Mild to moderate head pain, tightness or pressure sensation on both sides of head
General Description: A common type of headache characterized by dull, aching pain and tightness in the head and neck.
Treatment: Use over-the-counter pain relievers like ibuprofen or acetaminophen. Practice stress management techniques. Perform physical therapy or relaxation exercises.

name: Alcohol Intoxication
Symptoms: Slurred speech, impaired coordination, confusion
General Description: Excessive alcohol consumption leading to impaired physical and mental functioning, with potential health risks.
Treatment: Provide supportive care, including hydration. Administer thiamine and glucose for severe cases. Monitor for complications like respiratory depression.

name: Scurvy
Symptoms: Fatigue, swollen and bleeding gums, joint pain
General Description: A condition caused by vitamin C deficiency, leading to symptoms like bleeding gums, bruising, and fatigue.
Treatment: Increase dietary intake of vitamin C through fruits and vegetables. Use vitamin C supplements. Treat any complications, such as anemia or infections.

name: Narcolepsy
Symptoms: Excessive daytime sleepiness, sudden loss of muscle tone (cataplexy)
General Description: A chronic sleep disorder causing excessive daytime sleepiness and sudden episodes of muscle weakness (cataplexy).
Treatment: Use stimulant medications like modafinil or methylphenidate. Prescribe sodium oxybate for cataplexy. Implement regular sleep schedules and lifestyle modifications.

name: Food Allergy
Symptoms: Rash, itching, swelling, difficulty breathing, gastrointestinal symptoms
General Description: An immune reaction to certain foods, leading to symptoms like itching, swelling, or anaphylaxis.
Treatment: Avoid allergenic foods. Use antihistamines for mild reactions. Administer epinephrine for severe, life-threatening reactions.

name: Labyrinthitis
Symptoms: Vertigo, dizziness, nausea, hearing loss, ear pain
General Description: Inflammation of the inner ear, leading to vertigo, dizziness, and hearing loss.
Treatment: Use anti-nausea medications or vestibular suppressants. Administer corticosteroids for inflammation. Treat any underlying infection with antibiotics or antivirals.

name: Anxiety
Symptoms: Excessive worrying, restlessness, increased heart rate, panic attacks
General Description: A mental health condition characterized by excessive worry, nervousness, and fear.
Treatment: Engage in cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT). Use medications like SSRIs or benzodiazepines for short-term relief. Practice relaxation techniques and mindfulness.

name: Impulse Control Disorder
Symptoms: Impulsive behaviors (e.g., gambling, stealing), difficulty resisting urges
General Description: A group of mental health conditions where individuals struggle to resist harmful impulses, such as kleptomania or pyromania.
Treatment: Engage in behavioral therapy and counseling. Use medications like SSRIs for mood stabilization. Provide support groups or specialized therapy for specific disorders.

name: Stenosis of the Tear Duct
Symptoms: Excessive tearing, eye discharge, recurrent eye infections
General Description: A blockage or narrowing of the tear duct, leading to excessive tearing or recurrent eye infections.
Treatment: Perform tear duct massage for infants. Use antibiotic eye drops for infections. Conduct surgery (dacryocystorhinostomy) for severe cases.

name: Abscess of Nose
Symptoms: Pain, swelling, redness, discharge from the nose
General Description: A localized collection of pus in the nasal tissues, often caused by bacterial infection.
Treatment: Drain the abscess surgically. Administer antibiotics to treat infection. Apply warm compresses to reduce swelling.

name: Omphalitis
Symptoms: Redness, swelling, discharge, foul odor around the umbilical area
General Description: An infection of the umbilical stump in newborns, causing redness, swelling, and discharge.
Treatment: Administer systemic antibiotics. Perform surgical drainage if there is an abscess. Practice proper umbilical hygiene.

name: Leukemia
Symptoms: Fatigue, pale skin, frequent infections, easy bleeding or bruising
General Description: A type of blood cancer affecting white blood cells, leading to anemia, fatigue, frequent infections, and bleeding.
Treatment: Use chemotherapy as the primary treatment. Perform stem cell transplantation for eligible patients. Provide targeted therapies for specific leukemia subtypes.

name: Bell Palsy
Symptoms: Facial weakness or paralysis, drooping of the mouth or eyelid
General Description: Sudden, temporary weakness or paralysis of facial muscles due to inflammation of the facial nerve.
Treatment: Administer corticosteroids to reduce inflammation. Use antiviral medications if linked to a viral infection. Perform physical therapy for muscle recovery.

name: Conjunctivitis due to Allergy
Symptoms: Redness, itching, watery discharge, swollen eyelids
General Description: Inflammation of the conjunctiva caused by an allergic reaction, leading to red, itchy, and watery eyes.
Treatment: Use antihistamine or mast cell stabilizer eye drops. Apply cold compresses to relieve symptoms. Avoid allergens to prevent recurrence.

name: Drug Reaction
Symptoms: Rash, itching, swelling, fever, respiratory symptoms
General Description: Adverse effects caused by a medication, ranging from mild rashes to severe reactions like anaphylaxis.
Treatment: Discontinue the offending drug. Administer antihistamines or corticosteroids for mild to moderate reactions. Use epinephrine for severe, life-threatening reactions.

name: Adrenal Cancer
Symptoms: Abdominal or back pain, unexplained weight loss, hormonal imbalances
General Description: A rare malignancy of the adrenal glands that may cause hormonal imbalances, weight gain, and high blood pressure.
Treatment: Perform surgical removal of the adrenal gland (adrenalectomy). Use chemotherapy or radiation therapy for advanced cases. Administer medications to control hormone production.

name: Myopia
Symptoms: Blurred distance vision, eyestrain, squinting
General Description: A refractive error where distant objects appear blurry due to elongation of the eyeball.
Treatment: Use corrective lenses like glasses or contact lenses. Perform refractive surgery (e.g., LASIK) for permanent correction. Practice orthokeratology (overnight lenses) for temporary reshaping of the cornea.

name: Osteoarthritis
Symptoms: Joint pain, stiffness, swelling
General Description: A degenerative joint disease causing pain, stiffness, and reduced mobility due to cartilage breakdown.
Treatment: Use pain relievers and anti-inflammatory medications. Perform physical therapy and low-impact exercises. Consider joint replacement surgery for severe cases.

name: Thyroid Disease
Symptoms: Fatigue, weight changes, mood swings, dry skin
General Description: Disorders affecting the thyroid gland, such as hypothyroidism (underactive) or hyperthyroidism (overactive), leading to metabolic imbalances.
Treatment: Administer thyroid hormone replacement therapy for hypothyroidism. Use antithyroid medications or radioactive iodine for hyperthyroidism. Perform thyroidectomy for severe cases.

name: Pharyngitis
Symptoms: Sore throat, difficulty swallowing, swollen lymph nodes
General Description: Inflammation of the pharynx, often due to viral or bacterial infection, causing sore throat, fever, and difficulty swallowing.
Treatment: Use throat lozenges and warm saline gargles for symptomatic relief. Administer antibiotics for bacterial infections. Rest and maintain hydration.

name: Chronic Rheumatic Fever
Symptoms: Joint pain, fever, rash, heart inflammation
General Description: A complication of untreated streptococcal throat infection, leading to inflammation of the heart, joints, skin, and brain.
Treatment: Use long-term antibiotics to prevent recurrence. Administer anti-inflammatory medications like aspirin. Perform valve repair or replacement for heart damage.

name: Hypocalcemia
Symptoms: Numbness or tingling in fingers or around the mouth, muscle cramps
General Description: A condition of low calcium levels in the blood, leading to muscle cramps, tingling, and possible seizures.
Treatment: Administer calcium supplements orally or intravenously. Treat the underlying cause, such as vitamin D deficiency. Monitor calcium and parathyroid hormone levels.

name: Macular Degeneration
Symptoms: Blurred or distorted central vision, blind spots
General Description: A progressive eye condition affecting the central part of the retina (macula), leading to vision loss.
Treatment: Use anti-VEGF injections for wet macular degeneration. Take vitamin and mineral supplements (AREDS formula) for dry macular degeneration. Perform laser therapy for specific cases.

name: Pneumonia
Symptoms: Cough, fever, chest pain, difficulty breathing
General Description: Infection of the lungs caused by bacteria, viruses, or fungi, leading to inflammation of the alveoli, which fill with fluid or pus, causing fever, cough, and difficulty breathing.
Treatment: Administer antibiotics for bacterial pneumonia. Use antiviral medications for viral pneumonia. Provide oxygen therapy and fluids for severe cases.

name: Cold Sore
Symptoms: Small, painful blisters on the lips or around the mouth
General Description: A viral infection caused by herpes simplex virus (HSV), resulting in painful blisters on or around the lips.
Treatment: Apply antiviral creams like acyclovir or penciclovir. Use oral antiviral medications for severe or recurrent cases. Apply cold compresses to reduce discomfort.

name: Premature Ventricular Contractions (PVCs)
Symptoms: Skipped or extra heartbeats, palpitations, lightheadedness
General Description: Extra, abnormal heartbeats originating in the ventricles, causing palpitations or an irregular heartbeat.
Treatment: Avoid caffeine and stress triggers. Use beta-blockers for symptomatic cases. Perform catheter ablation for persistent or severe PVCs.

name: Chancroid
Symptoms: Painful ulcers or sores on the genital area, swollen lymph nodes in the groin
General Description: A bacterial sexually transmitted infection caused by Haemophilus ducreyi, leading to painful genital ulcers and swollen lymph nodes.
Treatment: Administer antibiotics such as azithromycin or ceftriaxone. Drain abscessed lymph nodes if necessary. Promote safe sexual practices to prevent reinfection.

name: Testicular Cancer
Symptoms: Lump or swelling in the testicles, pain or discomfort, changes in testicular size or shape
General Description: A cancer that develops in the testicles, often presenting as a painless lump, swelling, or discomfort in the scrotum.
Treatment: Perform surgery (orchiectomy) to remove the affected testicle. Use chemotherapy or radiation therapy for advanced stages. Regularly monitor with imaging and tumor markers.

name: Hydrocephalus
Symptoms: Headache, nausea, vomiting, cognitive or developmental problems, enlarged head in infants
General Description: A condition characterized by the accumulation of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) in the brain, leading to increased intracranial pressure and potential neurological damage.
Treatment: Perform surgical placement of a shunt to drain excess CSF. Use endoscopic third ventriculostomy (ETV) as an alternative. Provide physical therapy to address neurological deficits.

name: Breast Cancer
Symptoms: Breast lump, changes in breast size or shape, nipple changes, breast pain
General Description: A malignant tumor that develops in the breast tissue, often detected as a lump or changes in the breast's shape or texture.
Treatment: Perform surgery (lumpectomy or mastectomy) to remove the tumor. Use chemotherapy, radiation therapy, or targeted therapy based on cancer type. Administer hormone therapy for hormone-sensitive tumors.

name: Anemia due to Malignancy
Symptoms: Fatigue, weakness, shortness of breath, pale skin
General Description: A reduction in red blood cells caused by cancer or its treatment, leading to fatigue, pallor, and shortness of breath.
Treatment: Treat the underlying malignancy. Administer iron supplements or erythropoiesis-stimulating agents. Perform blood transfusions for severe anemia.

name: Esophageal Varices
Symptoms: Swollen blood vessels in the esophagus, vomiting blood, black, tarry stools
General Description: Enlarged veins in the esophagus caused by increased pressure in the portal vein, often due to liver cirrhosis, posing a risk of bleeding.
Treatment: Use beta-blockers to reduce portal pressure. Perform endoscopic band ligation to prevent bleeding. Administer blood transfusions and vasopressors for active bleeding.

name: Endometrial Cancer
Symptoms: Abnormal vaginal bleeding, pelvic pain or discomfort, changes in bowel or bladder habits
General Description: Cancer of the lining of the uterus, commonly presenting with abnormal uterine bleeding, especially after menopause.
Treatment: Perform surgery (hysterectomy with or without lymph node removal). Use radiation therapy or chemotherapy for advanced stages. Administer hormone therapy for hormone-sensitive cancers.

name: Cystic Fibrosis
Symptoms: Persistent cough with thick mucus, recurrent lung infections, poor growth or weight gain, salty-tasting skin
General Description: A genetic disorder affecting the lungs and digestive system due to thick mucus production, causing respiratory infections and malabsorption.
Treatment: Use chest physiotherapy and mucus-thinning medications. Administer antibiotics for infections. Provide pancreatic enzyme supplements for digestion.

name: Intertrigo
Symptoms: Red, raw, or inflamed skin in skin folds (such as armpits or groin), itching or burning sensation
General Description: Inflammation of skin folds caused by friction, moisture, and microbial growth, leading to redness, irritation, and discomfort.
Treatment: Keep the affected area dry and clean. Apply antifungal or antibacterial creams for infections. Use barrier creams or powders to reduce friction.

name: Parathyroid Adenoma
Symptoms: Fatigue, weakness, bone pain, frequent urination, kidney stones
General Description: A benign tumor of the parathyroid gland causing excessive production of parathyroid hormone (PTH), leading to hypercalcemia.
Treatment: Perform surgery to remove the adenoma. Administer medications to manage hypercalcemia. Monitor calcium levels regularly.

name: Glucocorticoid Deficiency
Symptoms: Fatigue, weakness, weight loss, low blood pressure, abdominal pain
General Description: A condition where the adrenal glands produce insufficient glucocorticoids, leading to fatigue, weight loss, and low blood pressure.
Treatment: Administer glucocorticoid replacement therapy (e.g., hydrocortisone). Treat underlying causes such as adrenal gland damage or pituitary dysfunction. Monitor for adrenal crisis and treat with intravenous steroids.

name: Temporomandibular Joint Disorder
Symptoms: Jaw pain or tenderness, clicking or popping sounds in the jaw joint, difficulty chewing or opening the mouth
General Description: Disorders affecting the temporomandibular joint (TMJ), causing jaw pain, difficulty chewing, and clicking sounds.
Treatment: Use pain relievers or muscle relaxants. Apply heat or cold packs to relieve discomfort. Perform physical therapy or consider dental devices for jaw alignment.

name: Wilson Disease
Symptoms: Fatigue, abdominal pain or swelling, jaundice, neurological symptoms (tremors, difficulty speaking or walking)
General Description: A rare genetic disorder causing copper accumulation in organs like the liver, brain, and eyes, leading to liver disease, neurological symptoms, and psychiatric issues.
Treatment: Administer chelating agents like penicillamine or trientine to remove excess copper. Use zinc supplements to reduce copper absorption. Perform liver transplantation for severe liver damage.

name: Vesicoureteral Reflux
Symptoms: Frequent urinary tract infections, urinary urgency or frequency, bedwetting (in children), high blood pressure (in severe cases)
General Description: A condition where urine flows backward from the bladder to the ureters and kidneys, increasing the risk of urinary infections and kidney damage.
Treatment: Monitor mild cases with regular checkups and preventive antibiotics. Perform ureteral reimplantation surgery for severe cases. Encourage bladder training and voiding practices in children.

name: Vitamin A Deficiency
Symptoms: Night blindness, dry eyes, dry or rough skin, poor wound healing, weakened immune system
General Description: A deficiency of vitamin A leading to symptoms like night blindness, dry eyes, and increased susceptibility to infections.
Treatment: Provide vitamin A supplementation. Improve diet with vitamin A-rich foods like carrots, spinach, and fortified products. Treat associated infections promptly.

name: Gonorrhea
Symptoms: Painful urination, abnormal discharge from the genitals, pelvic pain
General Description: A sexually transmitted infection caused by Neisseria gonorrhoeae, leading to genital, rectal, and throat infections with symptoms like discharge and painful urination.
Treatment: Administer antibiotics such as ceftriaxone and azithromycin. Treat sexual partners to prevent reinfection. Promote safe sexual practices and regular screening.

name: Fracture of the Rib
Symptoms: Chest pain, difficulty breathing, tenderness or swelling over the ribcage
General Description: A break in one of the rib bones, usually caused by trauma, leading to pain and difficulty breathing.
Treatment: Use pain management techniques, such as NSAIDs or opioids. Encourage deep breathing exercises to prevent lung complications. Rarely, perform surgery for complex fractures.

name: Ependymoma
Symptoms: Headaches, nausea, seizures, changes in coordination or balance
General Description: A rare type of brain or spinal cord tumor arising from ependymal cells lining the ventricles or central canal. Symptoms depend on tumor location.
Treatment: Perform surgical resection to remove the tumor. Use radiation therapy to target remaining cells. Monitor for recurrence with regular imaging.

name: Hepatitis due to a Toxin
Symptoms: Fatigue, jaundice, abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting
General Description: Liver inflammation caused by exposure to toxins like alcohol, drugs, or chemicals, resulting in jaundice, fatigue, and abdominal pain.
Treatment: Discontinue exposure to the offending toxin. Provide supportive care, such as hydration and nutrition. Consider liver transplantation for severe liver damage.

name: Vaginal Cyst
Symptoms: Small lump or swelling in the vaginal wall, discomfort or pain during intercourse
General Description: A fluid-filled sac in the vaginal wall, often asymptomatic but may cause discomfort or infection if large or irritated.
Treatment: Monitor small, asymptomatic cysts. Drain or surgically remove larger or infected cysts. Administer antibiotics for infected cysts.

name: Chronic Knee Pain
Symptoms: Persistent knee pain, stiffness, swelling, limited range of motion
General Description: Persistent pain in the knee due to conditions like arthritis, overuse, or injury, leading to reduced mobility and discomfort.
Treatment: Use NSAIDs or corticosteroids for inflammation and pain relief. Perform physical therapy to strengthen surrounding muscles. Consider joint replacement surgery for severe cases.

name: Pinguecula
Symptoms: Yellowish or white growth on the conjunctiva (eye's surface), usually near the cornea
General Description: A yellowish growth on the conjunctiva of the eye, typically caused by sun exposure or irritation, leading to redness and dryness.
Treatment: Use lubricating eye drops for dryness. Administer anti-inflammatory drops for irritation. Surgically remove the pinguecula if it interferes with vision.

name: Hypergammaglobulinemia
Symptoms: Elevated levels of gamma globulins in the blood, may be asymptomatic or associated with other underlying conditions
General Description: An elevated level of gamma globulins in the blood, often associated with chronic infections, autoimmune diseases, or malignancies.
Treatment: Treat the underlying condition causing the abnormality. Provide immunosuppressive therapy for autoimmune causes. Monitor for complications like organ damage.

name: Pituitary Disorder
Symptoms: Various symptoms depending on the specific disorder, including hormonal imbalances
General Description: Disorders affecting the pituitary gland, leading to hormone imbalances that can cause growth, metabolism, and reproductive issues.
Treatment: Use hormone replacement therapy for deficiencies. Administer medications to shrink hormone-secreting tumors. Perform surgery or radiation therapy for pituitary tumors.

name: Kidney Stone
Symptoms: Severe pain in the side or back, blood in the urine, frequent urination
General Description: Solid deposits of minerals and salts forming in the kidneys, causing pain, hematuria, and urinary obstruction.
Treatment: Increase fluid intake to facilitate stone passage. Use pain relievers like NSAIDs. Perform lithotripsy or surgery for larger stones.

name: Autism
Symptoms: Challenges with social interaction, communication difficulties, restricted interests or repetitive behaviors
General Description: A developmental disorder affecting communication, social interaction, and behavior, with symptoms appearing in early childhood.
Treatment: Implement behavioral therapies like applied behavior analysis (ABA). Use medications to manage associated symptoms like anxiety or hyperactivity. Provide educational and social support tailored to individual needs.

name: Cat Scratch Disease
Symptoms: Swollen lymph nodes, fever, fatigue, headache, rash
General Description: A bacterial infection caused by Bartonella henselae, transmitted through cat scratches or bites, leading to swollen lymph nodes and fever.
Treatment: Use antibiotics like azithromycin for severe cases. Apply warm compresses to swollen lymph nodes. Provide supportive care, as many cases resolve on their own.

name: Chronic Glaucoma
Symptoms: Gradual vision loss, peripheral vision impairment, eye pain or discomfort, halos around lights
General Description: A group of eye disorders characterized by damage to the optic nerve, often due to increased intraocular pressure, leading to gradual vision loss.
Treatment: Use medications such as eye drops (prostaglandin analogs, beta-blockers) to reduce intraocular pressure. Perform laser therapy (e.g., trabeculoplasty) to improve fluid drainage. Undergo surgical procedures like trabeculectomy for advanced cases.

name: Retinal Detachment
Symptoms: Floaters (spots or cobweb-like shapes in vision), flashes of light, curtain-like shadow over vision, sudden vision loss
General Description: A serious eye condition where the retina separates from the back of the eye, causing sudden vision changes, flashes, or floaters.
Treatment: Perform laser surgery or cryopexy to seal retinal tears. Conduct scleral buckling surgery to reattach the retina. Use pneumatic retinopexy or vitrectomy for severe detachment.

name: Aplastic Anemia
Symptoms: Fatigue, pale skin, frequent infections, shortness of breath, rapid or irregular heartbeats, prolonged bleeding or bruising
General Description: A rare condition where the bone marrow fails to produce sufficient blood cells, leading to fatigue, infections, and bleeding.
Treatment: Perform bone marrow or stem cell transplantation. Use immunosuppressive therapy, such as antithymocyte globulin (ATG) and cyclosporine. Provide supportive care with blood transfusions and growth factor injections.

name: Overflow Incontinence
Symptoms: Frequent or constant dribbling of urine, inability to completely empty the bladder, weak urine stream
General Description: A condition where the bladder cannot fully empty, leading to frequent dribbling of urine. Often caused by nerve damage or blockage.
Treatment: Perform intermittent catheterization to empty the bladder. Use medications like alpha-blockers to improve urine flow. Address the underlying cause, such as prostate enlargement or pelvic organ prolapse.

name: Rabies
Symptoms: Flu-like symptoms (fever, headache, fatigue), anxiety, confusion, hallucinations, difficulty swallowing
General Description: A viral infection transmitted through animal bites, causing neurological symptoms and almost always fatal if untreated.
Treatment: Administer post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP) with rabies immunoglobulin and vaccines immediately after exposure. Provide supportive care for symptomatic patients, although prognosis is poor once symptoms appear.

name: Hemolytic Anemia
Symptoms: Fatigue, weakness, pale skin, shortness of breath, jaundice
General Description: A condition where red blood cells are destroyed faster than they are produced, leading to fatigue, jaundice, and pallor.
Treatment: Treat the underlying cause, such as infections or autoimmune disorders. Administer corticosteroids for autoimmune hemolysis. Use blood transfusions for severe cases.

name: Lateral Epicondylitis (Tennis Elbow)
Symptoms: Pain or tenderness on the outer side of the elbow, weak grip strength, difficulty with forearm movements
General Description: Inflammation or degeneration of the tendons around the elbow due to repetitive stress, causing pain and reduced grip strength.
Treatment: Rest and avoid repetitive activities. Use nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) for pain relief. Perform physical therapy and strengthening exercises. Consider corticosteroid injections or surgery for persistent cases.

name: Syphilis
Symptoms: Primary stage: painless sores (chancre) at the site of infection, secondary stage: skin rash, fever, swollen lymph nodes, sore throat, latent stage: no symptoms, tertiary stage: severe complications affecting the heart, brain, and other organs
General Description: A sexually transmitted bacterial infection caused by Treponema pallidum, progressing through stages if untreated. Symptoms range from sores to systemic complications.
Treatment: Administer penicillin G as the primary treatment. Use alternative antibiotics like doxycycline for penicillin-allergic patients. Conduct regular follow-up tests to confirm treatment success.

name: Diabetic Kidney Disease
Symptoms: High blood pressure, increased need to urinate, swelling in the legs and ankles, fatigue, nausea, loss of appetite
General Description: Kidney damage resulting from long-term diabetes, characterized by proteinuria, reduced kidney function, and hypertension.
Treatment: Control blood sugar levels with medications and lifestyle changes. Use ACE inhibitors or ARBs to manage blood pressure and protect kidney function. Adopt a low-protein diet to reduce kidney strain.

name: Nose Disorder
Symptoms: Nasal congestion, runny nose, sneezing, facial pain or pressure, loss of smell
General Description: Disorders affecting the nasal structures, including conditions like sinusitis, nasal polyps, and deviated septum, leading to symptoms like congestion and breathing difficulties.
Treatment: Use nasal sprays or decongestants for mild conditions. Administer corticosteroids for inflammation. Perform surgery, such as septoplasty or polypectomy, for structural issues.

name: Drug Withdrawal
Symptoms: Anxiety, restlessness, irritability, tremors, sweating, nausea, vomiting, insomnia, drug cravings
General Description: Symptoms experienced when a drug is reduced or stopped after prolonged use, varying by substance but often including anxiety, tremors, and nausea.
Treatment: Provide a gradual tapering schedule to reduce withdrawal severity. Use medications specific to the substance, such as methadone for opioids or benzodiazepines for alcohol. Offer psychological support and counseling.

name: Dental Caries
Symptoms: Toothache, tooth sensitivity, visible pits or holes in the teeth, dark spots on the teeth, bad breath
General Description: Tooth decay caused by bacterial action on sugars, producing acid that erodes enamel and leads to cavities.
Treatment: Remove decayed material and fill cavities. Perform root canal treatment for advanced decay. Practice preventive care, including fluoride treatments and regular brushing.

name: Hypercholesterolemia
Symptoms: High levels of cholesterol in the blood, fatty deposits (xanthomas) on the skin or tendons, chest pain or angina, heart attacks, strokes
General Description: Elevated cholesterol levels in the blood, increasing the risk of heart disease and stroke.
Treatment: Use statins to lower LDL cholesterol. Adopt a heart-healthy diet and regular exercise. Consider other medications like ezetimibe or PCSK9 inhibitors for resistant cases.

name: Fracture of the Patella
Symptoms: Severe pain, swelling, bruising, difficulty straightening or bending the knee, deformity
General Description: A break in the kneecap caused by trauma, resulting in pain, swelling, and difficulty extending the knee.
Treatment: Immobilize the knee with a cast or brace for minor fractures. Perform surgery for severe or displaced fractures. Undergo physical therapy for rehabilitation.

name: Kidney Failure
Symptoms: Decreased urine output, fluid retention, fatigue, shortness of breath, nausea, confusion, chest pain, seizures
General Description: A condition where the kidneys lose their ability to filter waste, leading to fluid and toxin buildup in the body.
Treatment: Manage underlying conditions like diabetes or hypertension. Provide dialysis to remove waste products. Consider kidney transplantation for end-stage failure.

name: Fracture of the Neck
Symptoms: Severe neck pain, swelling, tenderness, difficulty moving or turning the head, numbness or weakness in the arms or legs
General Description: A break in one of the cervical vertebrae, often caused by trauma, leading to pain, swelling, and potential nerve damage.
Treatment: Immobilize the neck with a cervical collar. Perform surgery for severe fractures or spinal instability. Undergo physical therapy during recovery.

name: Muscle Spasm
Symptoms: Sudden, involuntary muscle contractions, muscle pain, stiffness, limited range of motion
General Description: Sudden, involuntary muscle contractions causing pain and stiffness, often due to dehydration, overuse, or electrolyte imbalances.
Treatment: Stretch and massage the affected muscle. Apply heat or ice to relieve pain. Use muscle relaxants or NSAIDs for persistent spasms.

name: Hemophilia
Symptoms: Excessive bleeding and bruising, prolonged bleeding from wounds or after dental work or surgery, spontaneous bleeding in joints or muscles
General Description: A genetic disorder where blood clotting is impaired due to deficient clotting factors, leading to prolonged bleeding.
Treatment: Administer clotting factor replacement therapy. Use antifibrinolytics to reduce bleeding risk. Avoid activities that may cause injury.

name: Hyperosmotic Hyperketotic State
Symptoms: Increased blood sugar levels, increased ketone production, excessive thirst, frequent urination, fatigue, confusion, fruity breath odor
General Description: A life-threatening complication of diabetes, characterized by extreme hyperglycemia and dehydration without significant ketosis.
Treatment: Provide intravenous fluids to correct dehydration. Administer insulin to reduce blood sugar levels. Replace electrolytes and monitor for complications.

name: Peritonsillar Abscess
Symptoms: Severe sore throat, difficulty swallowing, fever, swollen tonsils, voice changes, neck pain or stiffness
General Description: A collection of pus near the tonsils, often caused by bacterial infections like streptococcus, resulting in severe throat pain, difficulty swallowing, and fever.
Treatment: Drain the abscess through needle aspiration or incision. Administer antibiotics to treat the underlying infection. Use pain relievers for symptom management.

name: Gastroparesis
Symptoms: Nausea, vomiting, early satiety, bloating, abdominal pain, poor appetite
General Description: A condition where the stomach empties food slowly due to nerve or muscle dysfunction, leading to nausea, vomiting, and bloating.
Treatment: Adjust diet to include smaller, more frequent meals. Use medications like metoclopramide to stimulate gastric motility. Treat underlying conditions such as diabetes. Consider gastric electrical stimulation for severe cases.

name: Fat Embolism
Symptoms: Respiratory distress, chest pain, confusion, petechial rash (small red or purple spots), neurological symptoms
General Description: A rare condition where fat droplets enter the bloodstream, often after fractures of long bones, causing respiratory distress, confusion, and a rash.
Treatment: Provide oxygen therapy or mechanical ventilation for respiratory issues. Use fluids to maintain blood pressure. Monitor and support organ function in severe cases.

name: Polycythemia Vera
Symptoms: Increased red blood cell count, fatigue, headache, dizziness, itching, enlarged spleen
General Description: A blood disorder causing excessive red blood cell production, leading to thickened blood, increased clot risk, and symptoms like headaches and dizziness.
Treatment: Perform regular phlebotomy to reduce blood volume. Administer medications like hydroxyurea to suppress bone marrow activity. Use low-dose aspirin to reduce clotting risk.

name: Thrombocytopenia
Symptoms: Easy bruising, prolonged bleeding from cuts, petechiae (red or purple spots on the skin), nosebleeds, excessive menstrual bleeding
General Description: A condition characterized by a low platelet count, increasing the risk of bleeding and bruising. Causes include immune disorders, infections, and certain medications.
Treatment: Treat the underlying cause, such as infections or immune disorders. Use corticosteroids or immunoglobulins for immune-mediated thrombocytopenia. Perform platelet transfusions for severe cases.

name: Head and Neck Cancer
Symptoms: Persistent sore throat, difficulty swallowing, voice changes, ear pain, neck mass, weight loss
General Description: Cancers originating in the mouth, throat, or nasal cavity, often associated with smoking, alcohol use, or HPV infection.
Treatment: Perform surgery to remove tumors. Use radiation therapy to target cancer cells. Administer chemotherapy or immunotherapy for advanced cases.

name: Pseudohypoparathyroidism
Symptoms: Hypocalcemia (low calcium levels), tetany (muscle spasms), short stature, rounded face
General Description: A rare inherited condition where the body is resistant to parathyroid hormone, leading to low calcium and high phosphate levels.
Treatment: Supplement calcium and vitamin D to correct deficiencies. Use phosphate binders to manage high phosphate levels. Monitor and manage associated symptoms.

name: Goiter
Symptoms: Enlarged thyroid gland in the neck, swelling or visible protrusion, difficulty swallowing or breathing
General Description: An enlargement of the thyroid gland, often caused by iodine deficiency, autoimmune conditions, or hormonal imbalances.
Treatment: Use iodine supplements if deficiency is the cause. Administer thyroid hormone replacement for hypothyroidism. Perform surgery for large goiters causing obstruction or cosmetic concerns.

name: Urge Incontinence
Symptoms: Sudden, intense urge to urinate followed by involuntary urine leakage
General Description: A sudden and intense urge to urinate, followed by involuntary leakage, often caused by overactive bladder muscles.
Treatment: Use anticholinergic medications to relax the bladder. Perform bladder training exercises. Undergo pelvic floor therapy. Consider Botox injections or nerve stimulation for severe cases.

name: Edward Syndrome
Symptoms: Developmental delays, intellectual disability, distinct facial features (small jaw, low-set ears), heart defects
General Description: A genetic disorder caused by an extra chromosome 18, leading to severe developmental delays, organ defects, and a short lifespan.
Treatment: Provide supportive care to manage symptoms. Address feeding difficulties and provide nutritional support. Treat congenital heart defects surgically if feasible. Offer palliative care for comfort.

name: Muscular Dystrophy
Symptoms: Progressive muscle weakness and degeneration, difficulty walking or moving, muscle wasting
General Description: A group of genetic disorders causing progressive muscle weakness and degeneration due to abnormal protein production.
Treatment: Use physical therapy to maintain mobility. Administer corticosteroids to slow muscle degeneration. Consider assistive devices like braces or wheelchairs. Manage complications like respiratory or cardiac issues.

name: Mittelschmerz
Symptoms: Lower abdominal pain and discomfort occurring around the time of ovulation
General Description: Ovulation pain occurring mid-cycle, typically on one side of the abdomen, caused by follicle rupture.
Treatment: Use over-the-counter pain relievers like ibuprofen. Apply a warm compress to the affected area. Consider hormonal contraceptives to suppress ovulation if symptoms are severe.

name: Corneal Abrasion
Symptoms: Eye pain, redness, foreign body sensation, sensitivity to light
General Description: A scratch on the cornea, causing pain, redness, tearing, and sensitivity to light.
Treatment: Administer antibiotic eye drops to prevent infection. Use lubricating eye drops or ointments for comfort. Avoid contact lenses until healing is complete.

name: Anemia of Chronic Disease
Symptoms: Fatigue, weakness, pale skin, shortness of breath, decreased exercise tolerance
General Description: A type of anemia caused by chronic illnesses like infections, inflammation, or autoimmune diseases, leading to fatigue and weakness.
Treatment: Manage the underlying chronic condition. Administer erythropoiesis-stimulating agents (ESAs) for severe anemia. Supplement with iron if a deficiency is present.

name: Dysthymic Disorder
Symptoms: Persistent depressive symptoms (low mood, lack of interest, changes in sleep and appetite), lasting for at least two years
General Description: A chronic form of depression lasting for at least two years, characterized by low mood, low energy, and feelings of hopelessness.
Treatment: Use antidepressant medications like SSRIs or SNRIs. Engage in psychotherapy, such as cognitive-behavioral therapy. Adopt lifestyle changes, including regular exercise and stress management.

name: Scarlet Fever
Symptoms: Sore throat, fever, rash (red, sandpaper-like), swollen glands
General Description: A bacterial infection caused by group A streptococcus, presenting with a sore throat, fever, and a characteristic red rash.
Treatment: Administer antibiotics like penicillin or amoxicillin. Use over-the-counter medications for fever and pain relief. Encourage fluid intake and rest.

name: Hypertensive Heart Disease
Symptoms: High blood pressure, chest pain or discomfort, shortness of breath, fatigue
General Description: A group of heart disorders caused by high blood pressure, including heart failure, arrhythmias, and coronary artery disease.
Treatment: Control blood pressure with antihypertensive medications like ACE inhibitors, beta-blockers, or diuretics. Follow a low-sodium, heart-healthy diet. Engage in regular physical activity. Manage underlying conditions like diabetes or obesity.

name: Drug Abuse (Barbiturates)
Symptoms: Sedation, drowsiness, slurred speech, confusion, respiratory depression
General Description: The misuse of barbiturate sedatives, leading to dependence, overdose, and potentially life-threatening side effects like respiratory depression.
Treatment: Discontinue barbiturates under medical supervision to prevent withdrawal. Use supportive care in cases of overdose. Administer activated charcoal if ingestion is recent. Provide rehabilitation and counseling for long-term recovery.

name: Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome
Symptoms: Irregular periods, excessive hair growth, acne, weight gain, ovarian cysts
General Description: A hormonal disorder causing irregular periods, excess androgen levels, and ovarian cysts, often linked to infertility and metabolic issues.
Treatment: Use hormonal contraceptives to regulate menstrual cycles. Take medications like metformin for insulin resistance. Adopt a healthy lifestyle with weight management and regular exercise. Consider fertility treatments if conception is desired.

name: Encephalitis
Symptoms: Headache, fever, confusion, seizures, neurological symptoms
General Description: Inflammation of the brain, often caused by viral infections, leading to fever, headache, seizures, and neurological deficits.
Treatment: Administer antiviral medications for viral causes. Use corticosteroids to reduce inflammation. Provide supportive care like hydration and fever management. Consider rehabilitation for neurological recovery.

name: Cyst of the Eyelid
Symptoms: Painful lump or swelling on the eyelid, redness, tenderness
General Description: A small, usually painless bump on the eyelid caused by a blocked oil gland, also known as a chalazion.
Treatment: Apply warm compresses several times a day. Use over-the-counter anti-inflammatory eye drops. Perform surgical drainage if the cyst persists. Maintain good eyelid hygiene.

name: Balanitis
Symptoms: Inflammation of the glans penis (tip of the penis), redness, swelling, pain
General Description: Inflammation of the foreskin or glans penis, often caused by infections, poor hygiene, or skin conditions.
Treatment: Apply topical antifungal or antibiotic creams based on the cause. Use corticosteroid creams for inflammation. Maintain proper genital hygiene. Consider circumcision for recurrent cases.

name: Foreign Body in the Throat
Symptoms: Sensation of a foreign object stuck in the throat, difficulty swallowing or speaking
General Description: An object lodged in the throat, causing discomfort, difficulty swallowing, or airway obstruction.
Treatment: Perform Heimlich maneuver if choking. Remove the object using medical instruments. Use endoscopy for deep or difficult-to-reach objects. Provide supportive care to address irritation or injury.

name: Drug Abuse (Cocaine)
Symptoms: Euphoria, increased energy, dilated pupils, rapid heart rate, high blood pressure, risk of heart attack or stroke
General Description: The misuse of cocaine, a powerful stimulant, leading to addiction, cardiovascular issues, and neurological damage.
Treatment: Discontinue use and enter a rehabilitation program. Use behavioral therapy like CBT for addiction management. Provide medications to treat withdrawal symptoms or underlying mental health conditions. Monitor for complications like heart attack or stroke.

name: Optic Neuritis
Symptoms: Vision loss or blurry vision, eye pain with eye movement, color vision impairment, flashing lights or floaters
General Description: Inflammation of the optic nerve, causing vision loss, pain with eye movement, and sometimes linked to multiple sclerosis.
Treatment: Administer corticosteroids to reduce inflammation. Use immunomodulatory therapy for associated conditions like MS. Monitor vision and neurological health regularly.

name: Intestinal Malabsorption
Symptoms: Chronic diarrhea, weight loss, abdominal pain or bloating, nutrient deficiencies (vitamins, minerals), fatigue, failure to thrive
General Description: A condition where the intestines cannot absorb nutrients effectively, leading to malnutrition, diarrhea, and weight loss.
Treatment: Treat underlying causes like celiac disease or infections. Follow a specific diet, such as gluten-free for celiac disease. Take vitamin and mineral supplements. Use pancreatic enzymes for pancreatic insufficiency.

name: Lead Poisoning
Symptoms: Fatigue, abdominal pain, joint pain, memory loss or cognitive difficulties, developmental delays (in children), anemia
General Description: Toxicity caused by lead exposure, leading to abdominal pain, developmental delays, and neurological issues.
Treatment: Remove the source of lead exposure. Use chelation therapy with agents like EDTA for severe cases. Provide supportive care, including hydration and symptom management.

name: Viral Warts
Symptoms: Small, rough growths on the skin or mucous membranes, typically painless, may appear in clusters or as single lesions
General Description: Benign skin growths caused by human papillomavirus (HPV), often appearing on hands, feet, or genitals.
Treatment: Use over-the-counter salicylic acid treatments. Apply cryotherapy (freezing) by a healthcare provider. Use prescription medications like imiquimod for stubborn warts. Perform surgical removal for resistant cases.

name: Hyperhidrosis
Symptoms: Excessive sweating (beyond what is necessary for temperature regulation), typically in specific areas (such as palms, soles, underarms), may interfere with daily activities
General Description: Excessive sweating beyond physiological needs, often affecting the hands, feet, and underarms.
Treatment: Use antiperspirants containing aluminum chloride. Undergo botulinum toxin (Botox) injections. Consider iontophoresis for hands and feet. Perform surgery (sympathectomy) for severe cases.

name: Stroke
Symptoms: Sudden numbness or weakness of the face, arm, or leg (typically on one side of the body), confusion, trouble speaking or understanding, severe headache
General Description: A sudden interruption of blood supply to the brain due to a clot (ischemic stroke) or bleeding (hemorrhagic stroke), causing neurological deficits.
Treatment: Administer thrombolytics (clot-busting drugs) for ischemic stroke. Perform mechanical thrombectomy to remove clots. Use medications to control blood pressure and prevent recurrence. Provide rehabilitation therapy for motor and cognitive recovery.

name: Pilonidal Cyst
Symptoms: Pain or discomfort in the tailbone area, swelling, redness, drainage of pus or blood, abscess formation
General Description: A cyst or abscess near the tailbone that contains hair and skin debris, often resulting in pain, swelling, and redness.
Treatment: Drain the cyst surgically. Keep the area clean and dry. Use antibiotics if there’s an infection. Perform surgery to remove the cyst if it recurs frequently.

name: Crushing Injury
Symptoms: Severe pain, swelling, deformity, bruising, difficulty moving or using the affected area
General Description: Trauma caused by heavy pressure on a body part, leading to tissue damage, fractures, and possible compartment syndrome.
Treatment: Stop the source of compression immediately. Stabilize the injury and control bleeding. Provide intravenous fluids to prevent shock. Perform surgery for severe tissue or vascular damage.

name: Normal Pressure Hydrocephalus
Symptoms: Gait disturbances, urinary incontinence, cognitive decline or dementia-like symptoms
General Description: A condition characterized by an accumulation of cerebrospinal fluid in the brain's ventricles, causing difficulty walking, urinary incontinence, and cognitive decline.
Treatment: Perform a ventriculoperitoneal shunt surgery to drain excess fluid. Conduct physical therapy to improve mobility. Monitor and manage symptoms regularly.

name: Alopecia
Symptoms: Hair loss or balding, patchy or generalized hair loss
General Description: Hair loss that can occur in patches (alopecia areata), across the scalp (androgenetic alopecia), or the entire body, caused by various factors including autoimmune conditions or genetics.
Treatment: Apply topical treatments like minoxidil. Take oral medications like finasteride for androgenetic alopecia. Use corticosteroid injections for alopecia areata. Consider hair transplant surgery for permanent solutions.

name: Hashimoto Thyroiditis
Symptoms: Fatigue, weight gain, constipation, dry skin, depression, muscle aches and stiffness, sensitivity to cold
General Description: An autoimmune disorder where the immune system attacks the thyroid gland, causing hypothyroidism over time.
Treatment: Take thyroid hormone replacement therapy (levothyroxine). Monitor thyroid hormone levels regularly. Adopt a balanced diet to support overall health.

name: Flat Feet
Symptoms: Foot pain or achiness, difficulty with foot and ankle movement, foot fatigue, swelling
General Description: A condition where the arches of the feet are flattened, causing the entire foot to touch the ground, potentially leading to pain or difficulty walking.
Treatment: Use orthotic shoe inserts for support. Perform strengthening and stretching exercises. Wear supportive footwear. Undergo surgery in severe cases.

name: Nonalcoholic Liver Disease (NASH)
Symptoms: Fatigue, abdominal swelling or pain, enlarged liver, elevated liver enzymes, insulin resistance
General Description: A progressive liver condition involving fat accumulation, inflammation, and damage to liver cells, not related to alcohol consumption.
Treatment: Lose weight through diet and exercise. Manage underlying conditions like diabetes or high cholesterol. Avoid alcohol and unnecessary medications. Consider liver transplantation in advanced cases.

name: Hemarthrosis
Symptoms: Joint swelling, pain, warmth, limited range of motion
General Description: Bleeding into a joint, often caused by trauma or bleeding disorders, leading to pain, swelling, and reduced joint mobility.
Treatment: Rest and elevate the affected joint. Apply ice to reduce swelling. Use compression bandages. Treat underlying bleeding disorders with clotting factor replacement.

name: Pelvic Organ Prolapse
Symptoms: Pelvic pressure or heaviness, urinary incontinence, bowel movement difficulties, discomfort or pain during intercourse
General Description: A condition where pelvic organs like the bladder or uterus drop from their normal position due to weakened pelvic muscles.
Treatment: Perform pelvic floor exercises (Kegels). Use a pessary device to support the prolapsed organ. Undergo surgery for severe cases.

name: Fracture of the Arm
Symptoms: Pain, swelling, deformity, limited mobility or difficulty moving the arm, bruising
General Description: A break in one or more of the bones in the arm (humerus, radius, or ulna), typically caused by trauma.
Treatment: Immobilize the arm with a cast or splint. Take pain relievers as needed. Perform physical therapy after healing. Undergo surgery for complex fractures.

name: Coagulation (Bleeding) Disorder
Symptoms: Easy bruising, prolonged bleeding after injury or surgery, excessive bleeding from minor cuts or abrasions, frequent nosebleeds, heavy menstrual bleeding
General Description: A condition that affects the blood’s ability to clot, leading to excessive bleeding or clotting, caused by genetic or acquired factors.
Treatment: Administer clotting factor concentrates for deficiencies like hemophilia. Use anticoagulants for clotting disorders like DVT. Monitor blood regularly. Avoid injury and certain medications like NSAIDs.

name: Intracranial Hemorrhage
Symptoms: Severe headache, nausea or vomiting, changes in vision, loss of consciousness, seizures
General Description: Bleeding within the skull, often caused by trauma, aneurysm rupture, or high blood pressure, leading to brain damage or death if untreated.
Treatment: Stabilize vital signs in an emergency setting. Perform surgery to remove the blood clot or relieve pressure. Administer medications to control blood pressure. Provide supportive care and rehabilitation.

name: Hyperkalemia
Symptoms: Muscle weakness or fatigue, irregular heartbeat or palpitations, numbness or tingling, nausea or vomiting
General Description: A condition characterized by elevated potassium levels in the blood, which can affect heart and muscle function.
Treatment: Administer calcium gluconate to protect the heart. Use insulin and glucose to shift potassium into cells. Prescribe diuretics to increase potassium excretion. Consider dialysis for severe cases.

name: Cornea Infection
Symptoms: Eye redness, pain or discomfort, blurred or decreased vision, increased sensitivity to light
General Description: Inflammation or infection of the cornea, often caused by bacteria, viruses, or fungi, leading to pain, redness, and vision problems.
Treatment: Use antibiotic, antiviral, or antifungal eye drops. Avoid contact lenses until the infection clears. Take oral medications for severe infections. Seek prompt medical attention to prevent vision loss.

name: Abscess of the Lung
Symptoms: Cough with phlegm or pus, chest pain, fever, shortness of breath, fatigue
General Description: A localized collection of pus in the lung tissue, usually caused by bacterial infection, leading to fever, cough, and chest pain.
Treatment: Take long-term antibiotics. Perform drainage if the abscess is large. Use supportive care like oxygen therapy. Treat underlying conditions like aspiration risk.

name: Dengue Fever
Symptoms: High fever, severe headache, joint and muscle pain, rash, nausea or vomiting, bleeding tendencies
General Description: A viral infection transmitted by Aedes mosquitoes, causing high fever, severe headache, joint pain, and sometimes bleeding or organ damage.
Treatment: Stay hydrated and rest. Take acetaminophen for fever and pain. Avoid NSAIDs like aspirin to reduce bleeding risk. Seek hospitalization for severe cases like dengue hemorrhagic fever.

name: Chronic Sinusitis
Symptoms: Facial pain or pressure, nasal congestion, thick nasal discharge, postnasal drip, cough, fatigue
General Description: Long-lasting inflammation of the sinuses, often caused by infections, allergies, or structural issues, leading to nasal congestion, facial pain, and fatigue.
Treatment: Use nasal corticosteroids to reduce inflammation. Take antibiotics if the infection is bacterial. Perform saline nasal irrigation. Undergo surgery like endoscopic sinus surgery for persistent cases.

name: Cholesteatoma
Symptoms: Ear pain, hearing loss, ear drainage, dizziness or vertigo, tinnitus
General Description: A noncancerous growth of skin in the middle ear that can lead to hearing loss, infections, or damage to nearby structures.
Treatment: Surgical removal of the growth. Regular ear cleaning by a healthcare provider. Use antibiotics or eardrops to treat infections. Schedule follow-up visits to monitor for recurrence.

name: Volvulus
Symptoms: Abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, bloating, constipation, bloody stool
General Description: A condition where a loop of intestine twists around itself, causing an obstruction and potentially cutting off blood supply.
Treatment: Immediate surgical intervention to untwist the bowel. Use of endoscopic detorsion in certain cases. Intravenous fluids to prevent dehydration. Antibiotics to treat or prevent infection.

name: Injury to the Finger
Symptoms: Pain, swelling, bruising, deformity, restricted range of motion, difficulty gripping or using the finger
General Description: Trauma to the finger, which may involve fractures, cuts, sprains, or dislocations.
Treatment: Apply ice to reduce swelling. Clean and dress wounds to prevent infection. Splint or immobilize the finger for stability. Seek medical evaluation for severe injuries or fractures.

name: Poisoning due to Analgesics
Symptoms: Nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, liver or kidney damage, dizziness, confusion, respiratory distress
General Description: Overdose or adverse reaction to pain-relieving medications like acetaminophen or NSAIDs, potentially causing liver or kidney damage.
Treatment: Administer activated charcoal to limit absorption. Provide antidotes like N-acetylcysteine for acetaminophen overdose. Monitor and manage organ function in a hospital setting. Perform gastric lavage in severe cases.

name: Atrial Fibrillation
Symptoms: Irregular or rapid heartbeat, palpitations, shortness of breath, chest pain or discomfort, dizziness or lightheadedness, fatigue
General Description: An irregular and often rapid heart rhythm that can increase the risk of stroke and heart failure.
Treatment: Use anticoagulants to prevent blood clots. Administer medications like beta-blockers or calcium channel blockers to control heart rate. Perform electrical cardioversion to restore normal rhythm. Consider catheter ablation for recurrent cases.

name: Pinworm Infection
Symptoms: Itching around the anus or vagina, restless sleep, irritability, anal or vaginal discharge, abdominal pain or discomfort, loss of appetite
General Description: A common parasitic infection caused by tiny worms in the intestines, leading to anal itching, especially at night.
Treatment: Take antiparasitic medications like mebendazole or albendazole. Wash hands thoroughly and frequently. Clean bedding and clothing regularly to prevent reinfection. Treat all household members to avoid transmission.

name: Urethral Valves
Symptoms: Difficulty or poor urinary stream, urinary tract infections, urinary frequency or urgency, abdominal distension, poor weight gain
General Description: Congenital abnormalities in male infants causing blockage of urine flow from the bladder, which can lead to kidney damage.
Treatment: Perform endoscopic surgery to remove the obstructing valves. Use urinary catheters to relieve pressure temporarily. Administer antibiotics to prevent urinary tract infections. Monitor kidney function regularly.

name: Migraine
Symptoms: Severe headaches, nausea, sensitivity to light and sound
General Description: A neurological condition characterized by severe, throbbing headaches often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light or sound.
Treatment: Take medications like triptans for acute attacks. Use preventive medications such as beta-blockers or anticonvulsants. Avoid known migraine triggers like certain foods or stress. Maintain regular sleep and eating schedules.

name: Arthritis
Symptoms: Joint pain, stiffness, swelling
General Description: Inflammation of one or more joints, causing pain, stiffness, and decreased mobility. Common types include osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis.
Treatment: Use pain relievers like NSAIDs. Perform physical therapy to improve joint function. Take DMARDs or biologics for rheumatoid arthritis. Maintain a healthy weight to reduce joint stress.

name: Sciatica
Symptoms: Sharp pain, tingling, or numbness that radiates from the lower back through the hips and down the leg
General Description: Pain radiating along the sciatic nerve, often due to compression or inflammation during pregnancy.
Treatment: Gentle stretches and physical therapy. Heat or cold packs for pain relief. Pain relievers if prescribed.

name: Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS)
Symptoms: Severe and persistent pain, changes in skin color or temperature, swelling, stiffness
General Description: A chronic pain condition typically affecting a limb after injury or trauma.
Treatment: Physical therapy to maintain mobility. Medications such as pain relievers or nerve blocks. Psychotherapy for emotional support.

name: Lupus
Symptoms: Joint pain, fatigue, skin rashes
General Description: An autoimmune disease where the immune system attacks healthy tissues, leading to inflammation in various parts of the body, including skin, joints, and organs.
Treatment: Take immunosuppressive drugs like corticosteroids. Use antimalarial drugs like hydroxychloroquine for skin and joint symptoms. Monitor and treat organ-specific complications. Follow a balanced diet and stress management practices.

name: Endometriosis
Symptoms: Pelvic pain (during menstruation, intercourse, or bowel movements), heavy menstrual bleeding, infertility
General Description: A condition in which tissue similar to the uterine lining grows outside the uterus, causing pain, heavy menstrual bleeding, and fertility issues.
Treatment: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs). Hormonal therapies like oral contraceptives, progestins, or gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) agonists. Surgical removal of endometrial tissue. Assisted reproductive techniques for infertility.

name: Chronic Headache
Symptoms: Persistent head pain, tension in neck and shoulders
General Description: Headaches that occur frequently or continuously, often associated with conditions like tension headaches, migraines, or medication overuse.
Treatment: Identify and address underlying causes. Take preventive medications like amitriptyline. Use pain relievers sparingly to avoid overuse. Engage in relaxation techniques like yoga or biofeedback.

name: Dry Skin
Symptoms: Dry, flaky skin with itching
General Description: A condition where the skin lacks moisture, leading to itching, flaking, and sometimes cracking.
Treatment: Apply moisturizers regularly. Avoid hot showers or harsh soaps. Use a humidifier to maintain indoor air moisture. Drink plenty of water to stay hydrated.

name: Eczema
Symptoms: Itchy, red, inflamed skin, rash
General Description: A chronic skin condition characterized by itchy, inflamed patches of skin, often triggered by allergens, irritants, or stress.
Treatment: Apply corticosteroid creams to reduce inflammation. Use emollients to keep the skin hydrated. Take antihistamines to relieve itching. Avoid known triggers and irritants.

name: Psoriasis
Symptoms: Red, scaly patches on the skin, itching
General Description: An autoimmune skin condition causing red, scaly patches on the skin, often on the elbows, knees, and scalp.
Treatment: Apply topical treatments like corticosteroids or vitamin D analogs. Use phototherapy to slow skin cell growth. Take systemic medications like methotrexate for severe cases. Manage stress and triggers to prevent flare-ups.

name: Scabies
Symptoms: Intense itching, especially at night, small blisters or bumps
General Description: A highly contagious skin condition caused by mites burrowing into the skin, leading to intense itching and rash.
Treatment: Use prescription topical medications like permethrin cream. Treat all close contacts to prevent reinfection. Wash clothing and bedding in hot water. Take oral antiparasitic medication like ivermectin if prescribed.

name: Urticaria (Hives)
Symptoms: Raised, itchy welts on the skin
General Description: A skin reaction causing itchy, raised welts that can result from allergies, stress, or other triggers.
Treatment: Take antihistamines like loratadine to reduce itching. Avoid known triggers or allergens. Use corticosteroids for severe cases. Apply cold compresses to soothe affected areas.

name: Insect Bites
Symptoms: Red, swollen, itchy bumps
General Description: Insect bites are injuries caused by the piercing of the skin by an insect. They often result in redness, swelling, itching, or pain.
Treatment: Wash the affected area with soap and water. Apply a cold compress to reduce swelling. Use over-the-counter antihistamines for itching. Apply hydrocortisone cream to reduce inflammation. Seek medical attention if allergic reactions occur or symptoms persist.

name: Contact Dermatitis
Symptoms: Itchy, red rash caused by contact with irritants or allergens
General Description: A skin condition caused by contact with irritants or allergens, leading to redness, itching, and sometimes blisters.
