Treatment: Avoid the irritant or allergen. Apply moisturizing creams or ointments. Use over-the-counter hydrocortisone cream for mild cases. Take antihistamines to relieve itching. Seek prescription-strength corticosteroids for severe reactions.

name: Dermatitis due to Sun Exposure
Symptoms: Redness, itching, rash, blistering
General Description: Inflammation of the skin caused by prolonged UV exposure, leading to redness, pain, and sometimes blistering.
Treatment: Cooling measures (e.g., cold compresses). Topical corticosteroids to reduce inflammation. Oral NSAIDs for pain. Sun protection to prevent future episodes.

name: Parasitic Infections
Symptoms: Intense itching, visible lice or nits in the affected area
General Description: Diseases caused by parasites such as protozoa, helminths, or ectoparasites. Symptoms vary widely based on the type of parasite and location of infection.
Treatment: Take antiparasitic medications specific to the parasite type. Maintain proper hygiene and sanitation. Use supportive treatments like hydration for diarrhea. Seek medical advice for complex cases or resistant infections.

name: Influenza (Flu)
Symptoms: High fever, body aches, fatigue, cough, sore throat, congestion
General Description: A contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses, characterized by fever, cough, sore throat, body aches, and fatigue.
Treatment: Rest and stay hydrated. Use antiviral medications like oseltamivir if prescribed. Take over-the-counter pain relievers like acetaminophen for fever and aches. Avoid spreading the virus by staying home.

name: Urinary Tract Infection (UTI)
Symptoms: Painful urination, frequent urination, pelvic pain, cloudy urine
General Description: A bacterial infection in the urinary system, causing pain, frequent urination, and discomfort.
Treatment: Antibiotics to eliminate infection. Increased fluid intake. Pain relievers for discomfort.

name: Bronchitis
Symptoms: Persistent cough with yellow or green mucus, chest congestion, fatigue
General Description: Inflammation of the bronchial tubes, often caused by infections or irritants, leading to coughing, mucus production, and shortness of breath.
Treatment: Rest and drink plenty of fluids. Use over-the-counter cough suppressants or expectorants. Inhalers or bronchodilators for breathing difficulties. Avoid smoking and other irritants.

name: Gastroenteritis (Stomach Flu)
Symptoms: Nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain or cramps, fever
General Description: Inflammation of the stomach and intestines, often caused by viral or bacterial infections, leading to diarrhea, vomiting, and abdominal pain.
Treatment: Stay hydrated with oral rehydration solutions. Rest and avoid heavy foods. Take anti-diarrheal medications if recommended. Use antibiotics if the infection is bacterial and prescribed by a doctor.

name: Urinary Stones (Kidney Stones)
Symptoms: Severe abdominal or back pain, blood in urine, frequent urination, pain during urination
General Description: Hard mineral deposits that form in the kidneys, often causing severe pain, blood in urine, and urinary obstruction.
Treatment: Drink plenty of fluids to help pass the stone. Take pain relievers like ibuprofen. Use medications like alpha-blockers to relax urinary tract muscles. Undergo medical procedures such as lithotripsy or surgery for large stones.

name: Osteoporosis
Symptoms: Fragile bones, loss of height over time, back pain, fractures
General Description: A condition that weakens bones, making them fragile and more likely to break, commonly due to aging or hormonal changes.
Treatment: Take calcium and vitamin D supplements. Use medications like bisphosphonates to strengthen bones. Perform weight-bearing exercises. Prevent falls and fractures with lifestyle adjustments.

name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
Symptoms: Joint pain, stiffness, swelling, fatigue, loss of appetite
General Description: An autoimmune disease that causes chronic inflammation of the joints, leading to pain, swelling, and deformities.
Treatment: Use disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs (DMARDs). Take nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) for pain relief. Use corticosteroids to control inflammation. Engage in physical therapy.

name: Type 1 Diabetes
Symptoms: Frequent urination, Increased thirst, Weight loss
General Description: An autoimmune condition where the body attacks insulin-producing cells in the pancreas, resulting in high blood sugar levels.
Treatment: Administer insulin therapy. Monitor blood sugar levels regularly. Follow a balanced diet and maintain physical activity. Manage complications with regular healthcare check-ups.

name: Type 2 Diabetes
Symptoms: Fatigue, Increased hunger, Slow healing of wounds
General Description: A chronic condition where the body becomes resistant to insulin or doesn't produce enough, leading to high blood sugar levels.
Treatment: Follow a healthy diet and exercise regimen. Take oral medications like metformin. Monitor blood sugar levels regularly. Use insulin therapy if prescribed.
